hyp: New China: Making the Excellent Returning Rural Workers into the Village Revitalizing Forces - Xinhua News Agency
Talent is the key to revitalizing the countryside.
Where do you find talent?
Excellent returning migrant workers are indispensable vital forces.
Xinhua News Agency
China's Xinhua News Agency, July 26, by wire  Subject: Putting outstanding returning migrant workers into the countryside to revitalize the vitality army
Zhang Xiong, 34, lives in Fruit Garden Village, Meishan City, Sichuan Province. In 2010, he quit his 10,000-yuan-a-month job in Beijing and went back to start a business.

After years of struggle, he now runs a family vineyard that earns more than a million dollars a year, becoming a small-profile wealthy leader and being selected to the village's "two committees" class.

In recent years, under the inspiration of a series of supportive and beneficial policies such as the country's fight against poverty and the revitalization of the countryside, more and more excellent farmer workers like Zhang Xiang have chosen to return to their hometowns to start up businesses, which has stimulated a spring flood in the countryside.

In the western part of China, Sichuan, a large province with a large population and export of labor services, has been leading the implementation of the "excellent migrant workers repatriation training project" due to the favorable economic situation.In 2019 alone, more than 8,000 village Party branch secretaries were produced from the repatriated excellent migrant workers, 61,000 village reserve forces were cultivated, and more than 20,000 Party members were developed, providing a powerful guarantee for winning the fight against poverty and implementing the strategy of rural revitalization.
Little is not little, the key is to look at the old country.
Since the reform and opening up, a large number of young and old workers in rural China have gone out to work and earned more, some of them have founded their own enterprises by struggling.

However, the objectively also led to the rural "emptying" to different degrees, especially the weakening of the rural grassroots organization, the village party branch secretary and the party members' team all showed the "one old and one young" characteristics, i.e. the ageing, low education, the village party organization leader team is not strong, the problem of the non-acceptance of the blue and yellow is prominent.
If the countryside talents and other factors are always flowing to the city, the countryside is in a state of "bloodless" and "anemia" for a long time, revival is a hollow word.

It is a policy to resolve the problem of the inadequacy of the cadres of the rural Party and the grassroots Party organizations by attracting back those farmer workers who are capable, aware and willing to serve their hometowns, guiding them back to their hometowns to start businesses and become leaders in making them rich, and by selecting the best candidates to train them into Party members and rural cadres.
Good farmers are attracted back, but they must be able to stay and do well.

In recent years, Sichuan has been working hard to establish the peasant workers' party, and on the basis of strict selection criteria, has established the system mechanisms of attracting excellent peasant workers, guaranteeing their services, training them to improve their performance, selecting them for employment, and using them for their future, so that they can really take root in the countryside and have a sense of success in entrepreneurship.
This year is the year of the recruitment of the fight to fight poverty and strengthen the government, and the link between fighting poverty and strengthening the countryside is key.

The Party committee governments at all levels should attach great importance to the outstanding returning rural migrant workers, and through comprehensive measures, make them into a workforce that can survive, fight and carry on, and a vital force, providing strong organizational guarantees and talent support for rural people to escape poverty and run for a better life and develop themselves.

"Follow your heart, seize the opportunity, and ignore the consequences, sometimes you will get unexpected results.
Although it is a graduation song party, many songs also make the unfit graduates moved.
"The whole scene really makes me want to cry, and everyone's youth is full of beauty and regret, but it's worth remembering, and we should all walk bravely.
Beijing's natural ecology continues to attract more than 500 species of wildlife to " settle " - China Economic News Agency
Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Wang Sishou
Capital's Natural Ecology Continues to Be Good Attracting Wildlife to Settle in the City
Beijing's wildlife has reached more than 500 species

The Beijing Youth Daily's reporter for the City Garden Greening Bureau (CWB) was told that the species and number of wildlife have been increasing in recent years as the natural environment in the capital has continued to improve.

At present, the number of terrestrial vertebrate wildlife inhabiting Beijing has increased to more than 500 species, including nationally protected species such as brown cockroaches, black storks, and nationally protected species such as gazelle, great swan, grey crane, and duck.

Whether planted in a city forest in the Second Ring or in a small wetland embedded in buildings, it not only brings the city’s citizens nature’s wilderness, but also attracts wildlife to “settle” in the city.
In the peak of summer, it is a dynamic part of the Matsuyama National Nature Reserve in Yanqing District in the northwest Yanshan Mountains.
A fox was playing by the stream, and two badgers were fighting with each other.

As of the end of 2019, 178 species of wildlife including the gold carvings of the nationally protected animals and the second-class protected animals, including the scoop chicken and the gazelle, live in the green sea covering more than 6200 hectares, and nearly a third of the city's wildlife species can be seen here, said Hu Qiali, director of the Matsuyama National Nature Reserve Administration.
"In Matsuyama, wildlife is the real 'owner' and our staff can only be the 'guardian' at best," he said.
Mr. Hu said more than 30 professional rangers patrol the area every day, following 16 carefully designed routes, and a "roundabout" every month, covering almost the entire area for the entire day.
"The inspections not only check the biodiversity records, but also the installation of artificial bird nests, the rescue of injured wildlife, the installation of outdoor infrared cameras, and so on.
The Matsuyama National Nature Reserve has installed more than 200 infrared cameras to record the living conditions of wildlife in the forest.

As the biodiversity of the protected areas has become more and more abundant over the years, more and more wildlife has been featured in the film, and leopard cats, rhinos and badgers have become regular guests.

Zhang Zhiming, director of the Wildlife and Wetland Protection Department of the Beijing Botanical Greening Bureau, said that the number of terrestrial vertebrate wildlife in Beijing has increased from 461 species in 1994 to more than 500 species today.
The appearance of wild animals in the city is becoming more and more common, and it is closely related to the urban greening of the capital city.

In particular, the new round of million-acre forest greening construction, which began in 2018, proposes to reshape the urban ecological environment, enhance the ecological function of forest lands and green spaces, and highlight the concept of "near nature".

The park is designed to interact with the surrounding green spaces, to facilitate wildlife "visiting friends and family", and the trees planted are also the animals' favorite honey and food source plants.
"The Black Land" and "Seed" in Agricultural Modernization - Xinhua News Agency
Xinhua News Agency, Harbin, July 26, wire-mail  Subject: Black land "seed" to modernize agriculture

In the summer, two spraying agents planes passed through the 10,000-acre high-yield demonstration fields of the second operational station of the Friendship Farm's Fifth Management Area, forming two white lines.

The aircraft sprays pesticides on more than 6,000 acres of farmland a day, eight times more efficient than drones and hundreds of times more efficient than human-made ones, said Kong Lingqiang, the head of the operations station.

The farm is located in Friendship County, Heilongjiang Province, China's first food-producing province. From the past "hacking" of the cutting of rice to the present "long-long" motor sound, Chinese traditional farming and farming in this black soil zone has been transformed.
In addition to aircraft, satellites are also used in modern agricultural production on Friendship Farms.

On the one hand, they use satellite remote sensing technology to achieve accurate fertilization, reduce agricultural inputs and reduce pollution, and on the other hand, satellite navigation technology can improve the standardized operation level of farm machinery and fields, Mr.
In the rice production this year, the farm expanded its satellite-navigated, unmanned-seedling operation from 3,000 to 30,000 acres last year.
This technology makes the seedlings more evenly planted, maximizes the use of sunlight and arable land resources, and saves $16 per acre in labor costs.
Farms try to use information technology and intelligent technology in agricultural production, and form the largest agricultural machinery group in China from the ground to the sky.
According to statistics, the total number of farm machinery holdings is 49,000 units (pieces), and the combined mechanization rate of the field is 99.8%.
Agricultural machinery operations achieved 100% GPS satellite navigation, 100% precision sowing in dry fields, 100% operation of dry fields horsepower locomotives.
Green agriculture, intelligent agriculture and digital agriculture are the directions of agricultural modernization.
said Liu Hualian, the director of Friendship Farm.
The key to modernization of agriculture lies in the progress of science and technology.

In recent years, Heilongjiang Agricultural Reclamation, which is represented by farms, has played a leading role in demonstrating and guiding modern large-scale agriculture as a "carrier", and has initially established a modern agricultural industrial system that is dominated by scale-up cultivation, standardized production and industrialized operation.
In the suburbs of Friendship County, there is a 350,000-square-meter agricultural machinery exhibition park.
The exhibition centers on more than 140 agricultural machinery and equipment that Heilongjiang Agricultural Reclamation has introduced and used for many years.
These agricultural machinery and farms witnessed the development of China's agricultural modernization.
"The People of the Anhui River - Jiangkou River - Official Website".
Xinhua News Agency, July 26, by wire  Subject: People transferred to Jiangkou River in Hefei Anhui province
Xinhua News Agency reporters Chen Shanying, Wang Liwu, Liu Xiacun
At about 4:00 p.m. on July 25, Fu Qunbao, wearing mud-stained rubber shoes, went from front to back, and his wife Zhou Yan, back and forth, busy with their chores.
"I got a call from the village cadres asking me to move, and I'm still grazing in the fields.
Fu Qunbao said he has turned over 60 acres and planted rice and is doing well. "I took some medicine yesterday and haven't finished cleaning up my tools yet.
Fu Kunbao pointed to the pesticide sprayer in the corner. No one wants to be flooded.

To cope with the continuing high water level pressure and possible heavy rainfall in Neshu Lake, Hefei, Anhui Province, is preparing to open flood-division and storage facilities on the Jiangkou River in the Po Po River, where Fu Kunbao's family lives, on 26th.
The Jiangkou River is located in the western part of the county, close to the Great Embankment of the Lake Nest.
There are several thousand villagers in Wei who need to be transferred to Yandian Township and Sanhe Township.
As of 16:00 on 25th, the water level of the 5th largest freshwater lake in China, Lake Ness, remained at 13.2 m, exceeding the guaranteed water level of 0.7 m.
The kitchen of Fu Qunbao's was neat and clean, with a bowl of pumpkins on the table and eggs and some hazelnuts in the refrigerator.
“I didn’t think I would move, and the water in Chiangkou River looks good.”
Zhou Yan said the house is flat, some large objects have not yet thought about where to put.
"Put your valuables away first, and then put the refrigerator, the TV set, and the other big items in your high-rise neighbors' or relatives' homes for a while.
The village official Wang Li stabbed Fu Kunbao with an idea.
The wards are responsible for the relocation of 13 villagers, and each villager is notified of the relocation plan.
The nearest school to the village is the village of Shang, about 2 km away.
In addition to the large items, Fu Kunbao has two headaches and more than 1,000 kilograms of food and some newly bought furniture.
"The food is being hauled to relatives' houses, and the furniture is not moving.
The couple, after some discussion, put a stool under the newly bought bed and raised it about half a meter.
At 6:00 p.m., Fu Kunbao began to transport things to relatives' homes in a tricycle, and Zhou Yan continued to pack at home.
At more than 11 p.m., the couple looked around the house, pulled the electrical lock, and prepared to go to the place.
I hope the water will recede sooner.
said Fu Qunbao.
At 9:30 a.m. on July 26, reporters saw the scene of the Jiangkou River flooding at the Liuwei River, where preparations were made for the flooding.

France's Notre Dame church fire: parish volunteers admit arson peace and goodwill-Chinanews.net
The church of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, a jewel of religious history in Nantes, France, was severely damaged in a fire and the organ completely destroyed, foreign media reported on July 18.
On 26 January, the local prosecutor, Nate, announced that a parish volunteer who had been responsible for guarding the cathedral had been indicted on charges of "inciting arson and destruction".
He has admitted that he set fire to the church.
The 39-year-old parish volunteer from Rwanda admitted to setting fire to three of the church's interiors at night, local prosecutor Senath said, according to reports.
The man's lawyer said the arsonists now regretted doing so.
The man had entered France several years earlier by way of refuge, and had been given shelter in the diocese where the fire had occurred and had been taken into the church.
The prosecutor said he was in talks with the police about his recent attempt to renew his visa.
The church, however, said it still did not believe that the ordinary, kind, smiling, but unspoken believer would destroy the church he loved so much.
The volunteer was questioned by police on the day of the fire, but was later released after he had been questioned by police about a misunderstanding in his account.
The picture shows the firefighters on the scene.
On the evening of 25 July, the man was again summoned to appear, as new evidence was obtained by a professional engineer at the laboratory of the Central Bureau of Police in Paris.
This time, the man admitted to arson.
If convicted of arson, the suspect could face a 10-year prison sentence and a €150,000 fine.
The fire reportedly caused severe damage to the cathedrals of St. Pierre and St. Paul, where the organ was completely destroyed and the stained glass windows behind the organ were severely damaged.
The chief architect of the French Historical Preservation Building, Jean-Pierre Brunet, estimated that the restoration of the cathedral would take at least three years.
"China's unilateralism undermines US-China relations: China's anti-Americanism".

Xinhua, July 26, 2007 (TJPN) - On the morning of July 24, the Chinese Foreign Ministry informed the U.S. Embassy in China that China has decided to revoke the permit for the establishment and operation of the U.S. Consulate General in Chengdu and made specific requests to the Consulate General to cease all operations and activities.

The international public opinion believes that the unilateralist measures adopted by the United States have caused serious trouble in the relations between China and the United States.China has responded to the unreasonable provocation by the United States and it is legitimate and necessary to take countermeasures.

'The unilateral measures of the United States have damaged the bridge of understanding between the peoples of the United States and China,' said Andrea Borges, director of the Center for China Studies at the University of Chile's Institute for International Studies.
China's notification of the closure of the US Consulate General in Chengdu is a countermeasure to unilateral US measures and is in line with diplomatic practice.

Patricio Justo, professor at the Catholic University of Argentina and director of the Center for Sino-Arab Studies, said the Chinese decision was a legitimate and necessary countermeasure to the US's previous provocation, not against ordinary Americans.
The US is trying to distract Americans by pressuring China to cover up its weakness in dealing with the new crop.

'The U.S. has taken a provocative diplomatic stance, which has caused serious trouble in the relations between the two countries, and the two countries face serious challenges,' said Banpong Suryono, president of the Asia Innovation Research Center of the Indonesian think tank.

It is a normal countermeasures to notify the United States of the closure of its Consulate General in Chengdu.It is in line with diplomatic practice, reflecting China's principled position of resolutely defending its interests and the rationality and efficiency of Chinese diplomacy.
Tanzanian news commentator Francis Semwinza said the decision was a legitimate and necessary response to the U.S. provocation.
The US should take the initiative to improve relations with China and stop interfering in China's internal affairs.
The United States should focus on how to win economically and politically with China and how to benefit both peoples and the entire international community.

Ali Yousaf, executive director of the Sudan-based Arab-China Friendship Association, said the countermeasures China was forced to take were a legitimate and necessary response to US unreasonable actions, in line with international law and the basic norms of international relations, as well as diplomatic practice.
The US had previously demanded the closure of the Chinese Consulate General in Houston, in grave violation of international law and the basic norms of international relations.
The US hopes to reverse the decision and create the necessary conditions for normal relations between the two countries.
The United Morning Post in Singapore, in an editorial, said the US's larger strategic intention was to block China and prevent its continued rise.
Faced with the increasing pressure from the United States, China, while reluctant to see the relationship deteriorate further, has to take countermeasures.
(Interviewers: Yin Nan, Zhang Xiaoren, Ni Rui Jie, Liang Hui, Taku Chiu, Lis Bo, Ma Yi-chuo, Wang Li-li)

Xinhua news agency reported by wire in Guangzhou on July 26 (news reporter Mao Xin) that the Guangdong Marine Police Bureau, in conjunction with the Guangzhou Customs and Public Security Department, has recently eliminated a large-scale oil smuggling syndicate, initially verifying that the syndicate has smuggled about 120,000 tons of oil since 2019, with a total value of about <unk>?0 billion yuan and tax evasion of about <unk>?2 billion yuan.
The Guangdong Marine Police Bureau and the Customs and Excise Department have gradually worked out the division of labour and organizational structure of the gang.

On July 8, the Marine Police, Customs and Public Security Departments conducted a unified interception operation in Guangzhou, Foshan and other places, as well as in the Pearl River estuary, on the spot to seize four suspected smuggling vessels, seize 4,700 tons of finished oil from the vessels and oil storage facilities involved, respectively, and freeze a number of financial accounts.

It is understood that this joint operation, with a total of eight motorized ships and two helicopters, divided into several operational teams to fight together, to combat the whole chain of links such as maritime smuggling, illegal operation on land, 35 major criminal suspects all came to the case.
The case is currently under investigation.

The relevant heads of the Guangdong Marine Police Bureau said that the situation of high pressure will continue in the future to combat all kinds of smuggling and illegal crime activities at sea and maintain good order in the waters under the jurisdiction.
Hurricane Hanna makes landfall in the state of Med or triggers river surges and flooding - China New Net
Hurricane Hanna made landfall in Texas at 5pm local time on July 25, causing heavy rainfall, river flooding and potentially life-threatening mountain flooding.

The National Hurricane Center said Hurricane Hanna was expected to carry heavy rainfall, sweeping parts of southern and northeastern Texas, causing rainfall or torrential surges in some streams and life-threatening flash flooding.

Hurricane Hanna was reported to have been most severely affected from south of Corpus Christi to the mouth of the Grand River, and the Rio Grande Valley was likely to be affected by widespread flooding.
"Any hurricane is a huge challenge," Governor Abbott said on Sunday.
The hurricane placed 32 counties in the state under a state of emergency.
The city of Corpus Christi, with a population of over 320,000, has closed its libraries and museums and residents are on the move.
He said the hurricane could not be allowed to cause more deaths in Texas as the state was facing a new crown disease.
South Texas is expected to receive 6 to 12 inches of rainfall overnight on the 26th, with 3 to 5 inches of rainfall in northern Texas and along the Louisiana coast.
Due to global warming and other factors, Hanna formed earlier than previous Atlantic hurricane seasons.
Typically, the first Atlantic hurricane does not form until mid-August.
Poland to withdraw from Europe's treaty to prevent violence against women
The Polish Ministry of Justice said Saturday that Poland would take steps next week to withdraw from the European treaty to prevent violence against women.
The Polish right-wing government cabinet said the treaty violated the rights of parents by requiring schools to teach students about gender issues.
Polish Justice Minister Piotr Joblow told reporters that his Ministry of Justice will ask the Ministry of Labour and Family Affairs to begin withdrawing from the treaty Monday.
The treaty was also known as the Istanbul Convention.
"The treaty contains elements that we think are harmful in terms of their morphology," Joublot said.
The Polish ruling Law and Justice Party and its coalition partners are closely aligned with the Roman Catholic Church and advocate a conservative social agenda.
Polish President Aleksander Duda has made the issue of anti-gay rights one of his main themes during his successful re-election campaign this month.
On Friday, thousands of Poles, mostly women, protested in Warsaw and other cities against the withdrawal from the convention.
One of the protesters, Liam Patt, said during a protest march in Warsaw that "the purpose of withdrawing from the treaty is to legalize domestic violence".
Some protesters held banners that read, "The Law and Justice Party is the hell of women."
The leader of the Law and Justice Party has long complained about the Istanbul Convention.
The convention was ratified by Poland's previous centre-right government in 2015.
The government of the Law and Justice Party said the treaty did not respect religion and required liberal social policies to be taught in schools.
However, the party has not yet decided to withdraw from the convention.
(According to Reuters)
Brazilian President's new coronavirus test results
Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has announced on his personal social media account that his latest test for the new crown virus was negative, Xinhua reported on July 25.
In addition to the latest test results, Bosono also posted photos of himself holding a box of hydrochlorobenzene on social media.
Bosono has been adamant that the drug is effective in treating new crown virus infections and has shown his use of the drug live on social media on several occasions.
Brazilian media reported that Bosonaro had announced the results of the virus test and drove to the capital, Brasilia, to meet with a member of parliament.
Before that, Bosono had been isolating offices at the presidential palace.
Bosono himself tested positive for the new crown virus on June 6, and twice on the 14th and 21st, both of which were positive, he announced on a joint live broadcast of local media on July 7.
"Singapore to open 'Green Corridor' for youth".

The recruitment office of the Jiangxi Provincial People's Government has made it clear that those individuals or their children who have shown outstanding performance in the flood-fighting and disaster-rescue tasks, who meet the requirements for recruitment and who pass both medical and political examinations, will be given priority for recruitment, Xinhua reported by wire in Nanchang on July 26.
"After the applicants are registered, we will jointly verify the applicants' communities, the armed forces of the streets and the Xinyang District, and assign them priority to the military."

Wang Hui, deputy minister of the People's Armed Forces of Xunyang District, Jiujiang City, said they had concentrated on organizing a three-day medical examination for young people from 25th onwards as a result of the flood.
Zhou Qianfan, a 22-year-old college graduate from Xunyang District, Jiujiang City, is a community worker and a veteran of the Air Force.
"The news these days shows that the people's children and young soldiers are fighting to defend their hometown against the floods. I want to be like them," he said.
Zhou said he had a military dream from a young age, and through this flood fighting has strengthened his determination to join the army.

The city also uses flood prevention as a "living teaching material" for recruiting soldiers.They call on young people to volunteer for patrolling and checking dikes, on duty and on watch, and now realize the nature of the People's Army and firmly believe that they will join the army to report to the state.

"We hope to encourage more young people to apply for the military service by prioritizing the recruitment of soldiers," said Luo Jiuyu, a political commissar of the People's Armed Forces Department in Xunyang District, Jiujiang City.

From now until the end of 2020, Beijiang will have the necessary conditions, especially in infrastructure, human resources and land, to welcome foreign investments, especially multinational groups with value chains and advanced technology transfer.

In addition, the province will submit to the Prime Minister the proposals for investment in infrastructure construction and operation projects in the industrial zone of Vietnam and approve the document on the comprehensive plan for the development of the industrial zone of Vietnam by 2020, which will include the two industrial-urban-services zones of Anshan-Beilong and Anhui in the province.

At the same time, Beijiang Province has been working to accelerate the progress of various projects, especially infrastructure construction and operation projects in industrial park clusters such as Ho Fou, Gwangju, and Shuangxi-Nehuang, and has formed a land fund to attract investment.

In 2020, the North River Provincial Bureau of Trade and Industry will contribute to the formulation of a plan for the designation of industrial zones and industrial clusters to be incorporated into the provincial planning.

The province has determined that it will develop industrial park clusters in conjunction with the protection of national defense security, the protection of the ecological environment and the protection of food security, thereby contributing to the balanced development of industry; it will have comprehensive electricity, water supply, transportation and telecommunications infrastructure, and will be integrated with other social infrastructure such as urban construction, trade services, workers' housing and medical and health care, and education.

In the industrial zone, Beijiang province has been calling for investment projects in high-tech and clean technology in the fields of electricity, electronics, telecommunications equipment, precision machinery, and auxiliary industries.

In clusters of industrial parks, the province has called for small- and medium-sized investment projects in the production and utilization of local labor, especially in agricultural products and food processing.

In the future, Beijiang will focus on accelerating investment in the infrastructure of Beijiang Logistics Center, which will be developed in synergy with the clusters of industrial parks, in order to optimize the flow of goods and money and help reduce production costs, increase the value of goods, optimize supply chains and develop multimodal transportation, thereby creating an attractive environment for investors to invest in the province.
Russian Armed Helicopter Carrier-52M

The upgraded version of the Russian armed helicopter, the Ka-52M, will be completed for the first time in December and will be factory-installed, according to a Russian defense ministry plan, with a significant improvement in reconnaissance, communications and weapons performance.

The first two of the upgraded versions of the VNG--52M are undergoing conversion at Far Eastern Helicopter Manufacturing Plant of Progressive Aerospace Group, with the national testing and refit completion scheduled for October 2022, according to the Russian news agency.

The Russian experts who are known to have worked on the upgrade said that the "ancestor" of the "Super Short-Kiss Crocodile" - the Wuzhika-52 was officially installed in November 2011, the aircraft model exposed some weaknesses in use, this upgrade is to "complement the short board".

The new aircraft will be equipped with new anti-missile equipment, which will increase the chances of survival in the field; a larger generator will be installed to power more complex airborne electronics; the optical and electronic systems will be upgraded to detect and identify targets farther away from the battlefield; a new lightweight multi-purpose missile with a range of 20 km will be equipped with mainly attack armoured vehicles and reinforced concrete defenses, which will increase the range of similar missiles used directly by the Russian armed forces by about one-fold; and its defense weapons and communications equipment will be as common as possible with the M-28NM armed helicopters that can attack air targets, making maintenance easier and more economical.
The Ka-52M will also have advanced electronic guidance systems, weapons aiming systems, and navigational equipment.

Russian experts also said that it was of interest that the Ka-52M would be equipped with communications equipment that would link to UAVs, so that real-time information about nearby UAVs could be obtained in the air, such as images of the UAVs being filmed on the helicopter's cabin screen.

The Ka-52M's pilots are expected to be able to directly control the UAVs that are in service with the aircraft, thereby improving the pilot's command of the battlefield situation and the guidance of long-range missiles.
According to Russian media, Russian Deputy Defense Minister Sergei Krivoruchko said last December that the Russian Defense Ministry plans to buy more than 110 military helicopters by 2027.
The new law requires that masks be worn indoors and in public places in the greater Campania region, with a maximum fine of €1,000.

Hebei Province has been providing 17.5 billion cubic meters of ecological water to rivers and lakes since this year - China New Net

Xinhua News Agency (Wang Kun) reported by wire in Shijiazhuang on July 26 that the Hebei Water Conservancy Bureau has learned that since this year, Hebei Province has made co-ordinated use of the drainage water and local reservoir water, and has successively implemented ecological recharge to 28 rivers such as the Jiaotuo River, Tang River, Zhima River and Baiyang Dian, and has completed the accumulated recharge of 17.5 billion cubic meters of river and lake water.

Hebei Province has seized the favorable moment of increasing the flow of water from the South-North Water-Transmission Central Line Project and applied the drainage water to the Tang River, the Sha River, the Jinlong River and other rivers to provide ecological water.

At the same time, nine large and medium-sized reservoirs such as the Western Ocean, Dongwu Service and the White Ocean Dian River were used to replenish the ecological waters of the Xiangyang River and the Qinglong River, and the total surface area of the waters formed exceeded 90 square kilometers.

To do a good job of ecological water recharge, the Hebei Water Conservancy Office has actively organized the investigation, correction and reinforcement of rivers and river channels with potential for water recharge, fine-tuning practical measures and strengthening inspection and control.
Through supervised inspection and concentrated secret visit, all kinds of problems are solved in time, ensuring the river recharge is safe and orderly.

According to the relevant heads of Hebei Water Conservancy Office, the orderly implementation of ecological water recharge has effectively restored the ecological environment of rivers and lakes in Hebei Province, promoted the recharge and retention of coastal groundwater, greatly improved the living environment and economic development environment along the rivers and lakes, and has important significance for the management and protection of the rivers and lakes that are "clean, green, smooth and beautiful".

The British government temporarily removed Spain from its safe travel list late Saturday (25 July) at 0600 local time, and people entering the UK from Spain must be kept in isolation for 14 days.

"Airline to cancel 2000 Boeing 747s".

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) issued an emergency airworthiness directive on 24 April, requiring an emergency check of approximately 2,000 Boeing 737NG and 737 Classic aircraft registered in the United States, which could cause engines to stop in midair after the airlock valve was damaged.

The Federal Aviation Administration said it had received four reports of aircraft engines being stopped in the air so far on the 737NG and 737 Classic, and had therefore issued an emergency inspection request for aircraft that had been grounded for seven consecutive days or more and had flown less than 11 flights since re-entry.
The FAA warned that if the Class 5 check valve of all two engines on the aircraft were to be corroded, it could be stuck open, causing the aircraft to lose all power and unable to restart the engine.
The airline regulator ordered that airlines replace this key component before the aircraft could be put back into service once the check valve was found to be corroded.

Boeing responded later that day that the outbreak of the new crop disease had reduced travel demand, resulting in many aircraft being blocked or used less frequently, and that “stop valves were more susceptible to corrosion.”

Boeing also said it had recommended that airlines inspect the aircraft involved in the directive and that it would provide assistance in repairing and replacing the check valves if problems were found.

The Associated Press reported that airlines were flying more than one flight a day, but that a large number of flights were grounded after the outbreak, and some were re-opened as demand for travel slowed recently.
The Federal Aviation Administration did not release the details of four aerial parking reports.
Alaska Airlines revealed one of the incidents later that night.
The airline said in a statement that its plane on July 15 from Seattle, Washington to Austin, Texas, an engine suddenly went out and the plane finally made an emergency landing at Austin Airport.
Alaska Airlines said it had replaced the engines on the plane and had checked six aircraft engines as directed by the Federal Aviation Administration.
American Airlines, United Airlines and Southwest Airlines said on Tuesday that their aircraft had no engines that had been affected by the air-lock valve.
Four American Airlines aircraft will be inspected, and 28 United Airlines aircraft will be inspected.
Delta Air Lines said it would check 20 of its aircraft, but did not say if engines had been out of order.
Several media reports claimed that the Federal Aviation Administration's emergency landing instructions were another blow to Boeing.
Indonesian Lion Airlines and Ethiopian Airlines each lost one Boeing 737 MAX in October 2018 and another in March 2019, killing 346 people.
The series of aircraft then ceased to fly globally, and production was halted in January and resumed in May.
In June, Federal Aviation Administration Director Steve Dickson admitted that the agency had made a “mistake” in its regulation of Boeing’s 737 MAX aircraft.

Chief Secretary for Administration, HKSAR Government: Situation is critical - China News

The government will take more stringent control measures to further restrict business operations and reduce the public's space to go out, the Chief Secretary of the Administration Division of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, Zhang Jianzong, said on Sunday.
However, at this stage, the HKSAR Government has no intention of introducing a "home rule" or "foot ban" to restrict citizens from going out.
The following day, the government issued a statement calling for a "relentless fight against the disease".
He said the outbreak was the worst in half a year and that the next two weeks would be crucial to try to prevent further spread of the virus in the community.
In addition to taking necessary measures, it is also important for the people to be self-disciplined and cooperative.
He called on the public to stay at home as much as possible, reduce social contact and eat out.

The public should protect themselves and others by wearing a mask, pay attention to personal and environmental hygiene and wash hands regularly. They should also suspend unnecessary family gatherings or meals and reduce their visits to the market.

He said the Central Government has been very concerned about the changing epidemic situation in Hong Kong and supported the Government's anti-epidemic efforts. He also responded positively to the Chief Executive's latest request to provide assistance in enhancing the detection capability and refurbishing the Asia Expo Centre to serve as a similar "square-cabin hospital".

Mr Cheung said the Government had launched a comprehensive free virus testing programme for certain high-risk groups, namely elderly care homes, disabled and nursing home staff, restaurant staff, taxi drivers and property management staff, involving up to 400,000 people.
He was very concerned about the cases of infection in the elderly care homes. The Government had arranged special temporary quarantine centres for the elderly care homes.

The Government is building quarantine facilities near the Chiu Kai Wan Quarantine Centre in Lantau Island, New Territories, and is expected to provide an additional 700 quarantine rooms by the end of September.
The Chief Executive also announced on 19th that the HKSAR Government will build 2,000 more quarantine rooms at the Chiu Kai Wan Quarantine Centre and aim to complete them by the end of this year.
In addition to the 800 quarantine rooms already in use, the Chuk Lap Wan Quarantine Centre is expected to provide a total of 3,500 quarantine rooms by the end of the year.
There are currently four quarantine centres in operation in Hong Kong, providing about 2,600 quarantine rooms.
The Government also reopened Lei Yue Mun Park Resort on Hong Kong Island on 24 April as a community isolation facility for patients under 50 years of age with independent self-care.

"Segami Jiangnan" to Search for Poetry "Huanghe Dream" - CSN
(Chinese Poverty Reduction Story) "Sealing Up Jiangnan" Search for Poetry "Huanghe Dream"
"The Yellow River is a vast expanse of sand, and the waves and winds are bumpy from the ends of the earth," Zhongxinsha Yinchuan said in a telegram on July 26.

The Yellow River, which has inspired countless literati and children to be passionate, has nurtured the beautiful and rich Ningxia Plain. Now, Ningxia, which has the reputation of "sealing the southern Jiangsu River", is pursuing the idea of "ecological priority and green development" and the "Huang River Dream" in poetry.
The "Bamboo Dream" of Shimizu Show
The Yellow River flows through Ningxia, China, 397 km (97 mi) from the north to the south, and is the mother river of the Ningxia Province.

However, with the rapid advance of industrialization and urbanization, the development, utilization and management of rivers and lakes have imbalanced, and disturbances such as excessive discharge of sewage, lake-side farming, and encroachment on water bodies have emerged, leading to black odor, excessive water quality, environmental pollution, and ecological degradation.
Now Ningxia is promoting the restoration of water ecosystem diversity, and striving to restore the Yellow River to its water-quality level.
Water is to be treated from the source.

In Ningxia, the local government adopted the "bid + sewage treatment + strict management" method, all sewage in industrial parks was centralized, all urban sewage treatment plants were discharged according to the standard of Class A, and black odor water in urban built-up areas was basically eliminated.

In addition, Ningxia Province implemented the river lake length system in 2017, and now has achieved the responsibility system of the district city county village five-level river lake length system, river lake length patrol becomes the norm.
Gu Jincheng, 64, who lives in a village on the Yellow River, witnessed the change: "The water used to smell like a foam, but after it was cleaned up, it doesn't smell like one anymore.
Gu Jincheng said the ecological environment is better and his life is more comfortable. Now he often goes for a walk with his family by the Yellow River to feel the blue sky.
The "Wetland Dream" of the Sand Gulls
Birds, green trees, farmsteads, blue water ... the beauty of the "sand gulls' floating cluster" written by Fan Zhong became a reality in Ningxia's Yellow River Wetland Park.

The Yellow River passes through Ningxia, forming a variety of wetlands along the way, such as river wetlands, lake wetlands, swamp wetlands, etc., which play an important role in promoting the rational use of water resources and water ecological balance, and also becomes an important international bird migration route.

Since 2009, Ningxia departments have invested about RMB34.5 billion in wetland protection projects.At present, the area of Yinchuan Wetland is 19.2 million hectares, the wetland protection rate is 78.5%, there are nearly 200 natural lakes and marsh wetland, there are 5 national wetland parks, 1 national urban wetland park, 6 autonomous region-level wetland parks, and 8 city-level parks.

"The remaining gulls are an endangered bird species, with only 20,000 in the world, of which more than 2,000 live in the Yinchuan Wetland," Lü Jinhu, deputy director of the Yinchuan Wetland Conservation Center, told reporters.

At the same time, Ningxia has legally delineated a 500-meter red line for the cross-Straits Wetland Protection Area of the Yellow River and Yinchuan section, stipulating that no unit or individual may carry out development and construction and operation activities within the protected area, except for public welfare projects.
"The water is clear, the fish are swimming and the flowers are blooming," Zhao Shaoyong, vice director of Yinchuan City Water Conservancy Service Center, said.
The "Dream of Drinking Water" for the People of the People's Republic of China
Ningxia Yinchuan once had an "embarrassing" nickname: the only city along the Yellow River "to guard the water shortage".

Since 2010, the city has been facing a persistent summer rush hour water shortage problem, and the "water shortage pain" of the past decade has been a summertime experience for many high-rise residents, but under the current situation of over-exploitation limits in major water sources and underground urban underground water over-exploitation funnel area, water shortage has become a problem that has plagued the city.
Thanks to the improvement of the quality of the Yellow River water, the drinking water of the purified Yellow River becomes a good solution to the local residents' drinking water problems.

To improve the demand for water for urban and rural residents' daily production, Ningxia Province has launched a water supply project on the western boundary of the urban and rural areas of the Yinchuan metropolitan area in a timely manner, replacing the existing groundwater source with high-quality Yellow River water, Ding Ming, deputy director of the Yinchuan City Water Bureau, said.
"On December 29, 2019, the water supply project officially opened to the three districts of Yinchuan City, and in 2020, residents of Minning Town and Haran County also drank the Yellow River."

Ding Ming said the Yinchuan Water Department will consider the integration of rural drinking water and urban water supply in the region. "Next, we will integrate the distributed rural water supply points into the West Line after all, and we expect to achieve the urban-rural integration of the Yinchuan region by the end of this year.

US launches first anti-subsidy investigation against China for "undervaluing the yuan"

The US Department of Commerce has announced it has decided to launch an anti-dumping and anti-subsidy investigation into bundled products originating in China and into a project that undervalues the renminbi.

China's Commerce Ministry said it was the first time the U.S. had filed an investigation into a project that allegedly undervalued the renminbi's exchange rate in an anti-subsidy case, and China firmly opposed it.

The Ministry of Commerce issued a press release on the evening of the 23rd saying that China has a floating exchange rate system based on market supply and demand, adjusted by reference to a basket of currencies, and managed, and that the market plays a decisive role in the formation of exchange rates.
The press release stressed that, overall, the RMB's exchange rate was at a reasonable equilibrium level and was not undervalued.
Since 2005, the renminbi has appreciated by more than 17% against the dollar.

According to data released by the International Settlement Bank, the renminbi's nominal effective exchange rate rose 38% and its real effective exchange rate rose 49% between early 2005 and May 2020, making it the strongest currency in the G20 and one of the fastest-growing currencies worldwide.
The Ministry of Commerce said the exchange rate issue exceeds the power of members to conduct anti-subsidy investigations in accordance with World Trade Organization rules.
The US amended its rules in February to investigate countervailing duties on other countries' exchange rates, which have been subject to widespread opposition, on suspicion of violating WTO rules.
Even under US law, the press release said, the applicant's complaints were largely flawed and lacked the necessary anti-subsidy elements of financial support, benefit allocation and specialization.
China urged the US to abide by existing international rules and stop conducting anti-subsidy investigations into the so-called “undervaluation of the renminbi exchange rate.”

The renminbi fell sharply on the 22nd day of trading against the U.S. dollar, both of which fell below the $1-yuan mark against the yuan of 7.0, as tensions between China and the U.S. further heightened.
The US Department of Commerce's move is worthy of attention as to whether it is intended to push the yuan up.
The renminbi's spot exchange rate against the U.S. dollar rose 23 days to 6.9961, above the 7.0 mark.
The officially regulated renminbi-dollar exchange rate was down 17 basis points to 6.9938 on the 24th.

Brazil's city of Rio announces cancellation of New Year's celebrations - China New Media
Brazil has so far been the second-largest country in the world in terms of both confirmed cases and deaths, after the United States, according to the data.
The most severe outbreak in São Paulo was diagnosed in almost 480,000 cases, with over 20,000 deaths.
More than 160,000 cases were diagnosed in Seara and 150,000 in Rio de Janeiro, while more than 140,000 cases were diagnosed in Pará and Bahia.
More than 110,000 cases were diagnosed in both the states of Maranhão and Minas Gerais.

Rio de Janeiro Mayor Marcelo Crívila announced on 25 January that the city had decided to cancel the celebrations for the 2021 New Year, as the new crown pneumonia epidemic was spreading in Brazil and no effective vaccine was available.
The city has traditionally celebrated New Year's Eve at the famous Copacabana Beach, and the final day of 2019 attracted 2.9 million people.
The city also decided to postpone Carnival Day 2021 from February to September.

The mayor of São Paulo, Bruno Covas, announced on 24 December that the city's New Year's celebrations, originally scheduled for 31 December on Callista Avenue, would be cancelled and that Carnival 2021 would be postponed until the end of May or early July next year.

"Support for the Stability of Kindergarten Teachers in Yinchuan".

Xinhua News Agency (Aifu Mei) said on July 26 that the kindergartens in Ningxia's Yinchuan City have not been reopened due to the epidemic, especially the increasing pressure on private kindergartens' funds, which has some impact on the stability of the kindergarten teachers' workforce and the future sustainable development.

In response, Yinchuan City has taken a number of measures to support the teachers in these kindergartens, including the provision of pre-allocation subsidies for publicly-run kindergartens, the provision of stable subsidies for non-publicly-run kindergartens, and the reduction and waiver of rent for privately-run kindergartens.

According to the relevant policies of Yinchuan City, if during the epidemic period, the organizers of public-private kindergartens (including those in urban districts that have been converted to public-private kindergartens after the management of the supporting kindergartens) pay basic living expenses of not less than $1,660 per month to teaching staff in accordance with the minimum wage standards of the three districts, the city's finance will allocate a six-month subsidy fund to settle teachers' salaries and social insurance expenses in accordance with the standard of 1,000 yuan per student per year for the average funds for public-private kindergartens.

For non-public private kindergartens, which also provide basic living expenses of not less than $1,660 per month to teaching staff, Yinchuan will provide six-month grants to ensure the childcare teachers' safety and security in accordance with the standard of $500 per student per year.

At the same time, for private kindergartens that rent state-owned assets to operate, Yinchuan City will reduce the rent of the house for three months during the immunization prevention and control period, and encourage developers and other lessors to take on social responsibility, and reduce the rent of kindergartens and exempt the rent for more than three months, and according to the policy provisions, reduce the relevant taxes and fees.

Lewis Family: John Lewis is a warrior "for the weakest"
John Lewis, a U.S. Congressman and civil rights activist, was remembered as a soldier who "fighted for the weakest" at a memorial service for him on Saturday (25 July).
Lewis' public memorial service began on Saturday in Alabama.
There were two memorial services on the first day.
At a public memorial service at Troy University in Alabama on Saturday, Lewis's five brothers and sisters and a niece spoke of him as a loving, fearless, and family-oriented man.
Lewis' youngest brother, Henry "Grant" Lewis, said at the meeting: "He has been dedicated to helping others all his life.
Samuel Lewis says his mother warned John, "Don't get in trouble, don't get in trouble.

John did not listen to his mother's warning, he added, "We all know that John always gets into trouble, always gets into trouble, but it's because he insists on doing the right thing, it's a good trouble."
Lewis's brothers and sisters reminded the memorial that John's most famous argument was to create "good trouble", that is, to raise a case for the sake of justice.
John applied to Troy University in his hometown of Troy, Alabama, but was turned down by the then-white school.
John Lewis, who preached the gospel to chickens on his farm as a child, eventually earned a degree in religion and philosophy from Fisk University.
Years later, the University of Troy awarded Lewis an honorary doctorate.
Congressman Doug Jones of Alabama said the current protesters were "peacefully, non-violently protesting," as Lewis had done in the Civil Rights Movement.
Jones said: "Even if President Trump beat a boatman with a rod and called all the protesters thugs, he was wrong.
The protesters are patriots who want America to move towards a more equal nation.
A six-day series of events in honor of Lewis culminated this week at a funeral in Georgia.
Lewis's coffin was placed on display Saturday at a public memorial service at Troy University to pay tribute to the civil rights movement's founder.
Later Saturday, a private ceremony honoring him was held in a small church in Selma, Alabama, followed by an open memorial service.
On Sunday, Lewis' body will pass through Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma.
In 1965, he and demonstrators demanding black voting rights were beaten by Alabama police in front of the bridge, who also threw tear gas at the demonstrators.
Lewis was nearly killed.
This day is known as Bloody Sunday.
Lewis' body will be transported to Montgomery, Alabama.
Mayor Steven Reed encouraged people to line up on the sidewalk and finish the last leg with Lewis.
Officials also require that the public wear masks and stay away from social activities.
Governor Kay Ivey ordered the flag to be lowered halfway to commemorate Lewis on Saturday and Sunday.

During the week-long memorial service, Lewis' body will be temporarily placed in the Alabama State Capitol in Montgomery, Georgia, and the United States Capitol in Washington, D.C., to be used as a memorial.

Nancy Pelosi, the speaker of the House of Representatives, and Mitch McConnell, the leader of the Senate majority, announced last week that people could visit the Capitol on Monday and Tuesday to pay tribute to Lewis.
The public event to mourn Lewis will be held outdoors due to the coronary virus outbreak.
Shenzhen to open consultation on health regulations - Xinhua News website

Xinhua News Agency (Xinhua News Agency) in Shenzhen on July 26 (reporters Mao Siqian and Bai Yu) encouraged residents to do regular physical examinations and find problems early; ban the sale of alcoholic beverages to minors; establish a system for online games health examination; employing units to equip special part-time health managers ...

In order to encourage residents to undertake regular physical examinations and to identify problems early, the above-mentioned drafts of the request for comments are submitted that the health and hygiene departments should formulate a basic catalog of health examination items according to different age, occupation and other factors.
The health examination expenses within the basic list of health examination items shall be paid by the social insurance fund on the basis of the standard of one per person per year.

The Employer shall rationally allocate human resources, arrange working hours for staff, apply a system of rotational leave to employees with heavy mental and physical labor loads, avoid excessive loss of human and physical energy or injury to their physical and mental health, and strictly implement a system of paid leave for staff.
In addition, the employing units should be equipped with special part-time health managers and regularly organize health check-ups of employees.

In the area of the physical and mental health of minors, the draft opinion shall be submitted, prohibiting the sale of alcoholic beverages to minors, and limiting the location of sale of alcoholic beverages.
In addition to “prohibition,” minors should “exercise more.”
According to the request for the opinion, the school should arrange more than one hour of sports activities for students every day.

For online games, the public security, cultural, tourism, sports, network supervision, health and other departments shall improve the health supervision system of Internet service business premises, establish the system of health examination of online games, and create a good communication space and culture for the promotion of the healthy growth of young people.

In addition, the draft requested comments also suggested that influenza patients must wear masks when entering and leaving public places, and that medical and health institutions should be fined 20,000 yuan for disclosing patients' privacy without consent.

It is worth noting that besides the physical and mental health of residents, the drafts of the public opinion request also require Shenzhen departments to evaluate the impact of public policy implementation on the health of the population before formulating planning documents and normative documents involving urban spatial planning and construction, industrial park planning and construction, resource development and utilization and environmental protection, biomedical industry development, and approving major construction projects and implementing major public service projects.

Where an unevaluated or unevaluated project will have a serious adverse effect on the public health of the city or the health of its residents, it shall not be formulated, promulgated or approved for implementation.

Author: Lin Oh
"Shanghai-Tibetan Railway to Reopen in 2019".

Xinhua News Agency (Xinning) reported by wire on July 25 (journalist Wang Jinjin) that the monitoring showed that Tibetan antelopes that had migrated to the Chonohu region of the Cocos Territory before were beginning to return to their original habitats with their young.
On 25 July, about 40 female Tibetan antelopes led by three Tibetan antelope cubs passed 3002 km of the Qinghai-Tibet Highway and the Qinghai-Tibet Railway Five-way Bridge.
Experts analyzed that in recent years, the number of young Tibetan antelopes in the return sheep herd accounted for one-quarter to one-fifth of the total number of Tibetan antelopes.

"In the early stages of the migration, Tibetan antelopes are at high risk of predation, so the number of young in the flock is relatively small, and there may even be no young," Lian Xinming, a deputy researcher at the Northwest Plateau Institute of Biology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, said.
According to the National Park Service, the number of Tibetan antelope returns has been increasing year by year, with 4,860 in 2019, an increase of 338 from 2018.
"The return of Tibetan antelopes is expected to end in early September this year, and the number of returning Tibetan antelopes is still expected to increase," Lian said.
Tibetan antelope is a nationally protected animal.
At the end of May every year, Tibetan antelopes from the source of the Qinghai-Tibet Three Rivers, Qiangtang-Tibet, and Xinjiang Al Jinshan go to Lake Zhongno, in the heart of the Cocos Sea.

"The return of the Tibetan antelope is the process of female antelopes returning to their homeland after the hatching stage and bringing their young with them," said Wu Xiaomin, a researcher at the Shaanxi Provincial Animal Research Institute (NWRI) and a specialist in the conservation of Tibetan antelopes. "At first, the returning populations are relatively large, but later on, the antelopes will return to their homeland along different paths, depending on the geographical group," he said.

To ensure the safe return of Tibetan antelopes, the reporters learned that the Cocos Territory Administration of the Yangtze River Source Park of the Sanjiangyuan National Park Administration has arranged staff to carry out video surveillance and patrol in the main return area.

If a Tibetan antelope tries to cross the road, the rangers will first make temporary traffic controls to ensure that the sheep are safely through the wildlife passageway and that they are as unobstructed as possible on their way back.
So, how should we de-heat in everyday life?

Experts suggest that you avoid high temperatures as much as possible during the summer. It is best not to walk or work in the hot sun after mid-morning, because the sun is the strongest and the chances of heat stroke are higher.

If you have to go out at this time, you must do good protection work, such as shading the sun umbrella, wearing a sun hat, wearing sunglasses, and if conditions are best, apply sunscreen to protect against sunburn.

We should try to choose light-colored, breathable cotton, linen and silk fabrics, and wear less clothing of synthetic fibers, so as not to be able to dissipate heat in time when sweating a lot, causing heat stroke.

When you are in hot and humid weather, prepare enough water to drink, drink it in time, and do not wait until you are thirsty to drink water, because once you feel thirsty, you have no water, so you should drink water at a rate of 150 to 200 milliliters per drink, drink warm water, and do not drink ice water.
Depending on the temperature, the average person drinks 1.5 to 2 liters of water a day, while high-temperature workers drink 3 to 5 liters of water a day.
When sweating more, you can properly replenish some salt water to make up for the loss of salt in the body due to sweating.
In addition, the summer body is easily deprived of potassium, makes people feel tired and tired, potassium-containing tea is a great summer drink.

Eat plenty of watery fruits and vegetables in summer, such as raw vegetables, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. Fresh fruits, such as peach, apricot, watermelon, melon, etc., with a water content of 80 to 90% can be used to replenish water; dairy products can both replenish water and meet the nutritional needs of the body.
In addition, people working in high temperature environments should be properly supplemented with drinks containing potassium, magnesium and other elements.
Summer is long and short, the temperature is high, the body metabolism is vigorous, the consumption is also large, easily feel tired.
Sufficient sleep can relax the brain and body systems, both for work and study, and as a measure to prevent heat stroke.
Experts say the best time to go to bed is between 10pm and 11pm, and the best time to get up is between 5.30am and 6.30pm.
When sleeping, be careful not to lie under the air conditioner outlet and electric fan, so as not to suffer from air conditioning disease and thermal injury.

Experts suggest that people who are outdoors or engaged in high-temperature work should carry ten drops of water, human dan, herbal medicines such as herbal medicines or herbal medicine pills, or place them near the workplace for use at any time to prevent heat stroke.

On July 25, police in Switzerland reported to the media that a small aircraft crashed in the Swiss Alps.

"The first person to warn of the sand dam landslide" - China News Agency
On July 26, Enshi City announced that it had paid 50,000 yuan to Chen Guangming, a geological hazard site monitor, for his important contribution to the early warning of sand dam landslides.
At the same time, we call on the Party cadres of the whole city to learn the spirit of strictly observing his duties, daring to take responsibility, taking initiatives and being willing to give.
On July 21, a landslide in the sand dam at Majiacun, Tuenburi Township, Onshi City, caused the Qingjiang River drainage to form a weir, and Chen Guangming, 58, was the first to warn of the landslide.
On the afternoon of July 17, Chen Guangming learned of the cracking of the walls in the villagers' houses and immediately went to the scene to inspect.
He had just come out of his house, five or six hundred meters, and saw the village road split four or five centimeters, along the road extended to the corn field, about 50 meters long.
Chen Guangmington was alert, the first time to the road crack photos sent to the village "geological disaster monitor contact group".
The local authorities in Tuen Mun Township Natural Planning Office have verified and judged that the landslide is very likely and have made a decision to evacuate the people immediately.
The early warning by Chen Guangming won 36 hours of valuable time for the safe evacuation of 315 households and 1,339 people in the affected area.

New drug to treat angioedema caused by new coronary artery at University of Australia - Official website

Researchers at Monash University in Australia are developing a new drug that could help prevent heart disease and stroke and hope to treat blood clots caused by the new coronary virus, Xinhua reported in Sydney on July 26.
Researchers found that an enzyme in the throat accelerates thrombocytosis before a heart attack or stroke.
They have developed a drug that temporarily inhibits platelet contraction, preventing blood vessel clogging and preventing heart disease and stroke.
The drug only suppresses platelet clotting when heart disease or stroke signs appear, the researchers said.

Since studies have shown that similar blood clots are one of the main causes of death in patients with new coronary heart disease, the researchers hope the drug will be used in the future to treat such patients.
The drug has been shown to work well in animal models and researchers are preparing for the next phase of human clinical trials.
The results were published in the American journal Science and Transformative Medicine.

Xinjiang's deep-cultivated sunflower fields use clean energy, Xinjiang Times, July 26 (TJ) -- China's largest solar power plant, the Sunflower Field, is expected to produce more than 50,000 tons of solar energy annually

The 6,000-plus-square-metre (48 square feet) five-sided sunshades are arranged in a neat, circular pattern, like a silver sunflower field.The sun rotates with the sun, reflecting the sunlight to a 200-metre-high central heat-absorbing tower, generating electricity.
The reporter saw the scene at the CPC Hami molten salt tower photothermal power plant in Mu Maohu town, Igo County, Hami City, Xinjiang on 25th.

"The so-called salt-melt tower photothermal power generation is the reflection of sunlight through the mirror to the heat-absorbing tower to form thermal energy, and then through traditional power generation technology to convert thermal energy into electricity.

Zhang Yong, deputy general manager of CPC Hami Solar Thermal Power Co., Ltd., said the design principle is similar to the solar cooker used in rural areas in northwest China, all the sunlight is collected.
The plant was completed in October 2017 and is located on 6,600 acres of land, with a total of 14,500 sunshades planned to be installed.
"The biggest advantage of solar power over conventional power generation is that it can store the heat that is collected and generate electricity at night.

The 13-hour heat storage system, which is configured in the project, will keep the generators running continuously and stable, without being affected by changes in light, and will also be able to participate in the peak adjustment of the grid quickly according to the peak demand, Mr. Zhang said.

The project will generate 198 million degrees of electricity per year, save more than 60,000 tons of standard coal per year, reduce emissions of more than 60 tons of sulphur dioxide, more than 60 tons of nitrogen oxides, about 20 tons of smoke and dust, and more than 1.5 million tons of carbon dioxide, providing clean energy for the local community.
In addition, there is another silver "Sunflower Field" in the Ishiguchi Photovoltaic Industrial Park in Hami City.

The Hammover Light Solar PV Power Plant covers more than 2,300 acres and has 714 generating units that are built to follow the sun's rotation, keeping the sun's light and the surface of the photovoltaic panel 90 degrees straight.

"We use double-axis tracking photovoltaic technology and through integrated control, all the power generation equipment can adjust the angle according to the height of the sun to maintain the power generation efficiency.
The power plant's director, Meng Qi, said the technology could increase the efficiency of photovoltaic generation by about 20 percent compared to conventional power generation in sunny weather.
In the first half of this year, the power station has generated more than 7 million degrees of electricity, which has supplemented the local demand for electricity.

The park is the largest single-unit photovoltaic industrial park in Xinjiang, and the most complete photovoltaic component type demonstration park, with 38 residential photovoltaic power generation projects, a total installed capacity of 820,000 kilowatts.
The total electricity generated in the first half of this year exceeded 110 million degrees, an increase of 6% compared to the same period in 2019.
Hami is one of the best areas in China for solar energy.
The average annual total solar radiation is over 6200 megajoules per square metre, and the total annual sunshine hours are about 3200 hours.
In recent years, the city has been developing photovoltaic industry, sowing "Sunflower Fields".
The city has built more than 2.5 million kilowatts of solar power, and the first half of this year the city's photovoltaic power output exceeded 1.4 billion degrees, about 14% year on year.
At present, Xinjiang has more than 330 photovoltaic power plants with a capacity of more than 10 million kilowatts.
The total annual capacity of photovoltaic power is expected to reach 15 billion degrees this year, replacing more than 6 million tons of standard coal.
Police report details of "Women Students Traveling to Qinghai Province" search and rescue work continues - Xinhua News Agency

Xinhua News Agency ( Xining Daily News, July 26 ) (journalist Wang Jin-jin Zhou Zheng) Recently, "a female university student went to Qinghai Gulmu tour after disconnection" caused concerns on netizens.

The Guermo Public Security Bureau of the Hexi Mongol and Tibetan Autonomous Prefectures of Qinghai Province reported on 26th that Huang Xing, a student of a university in Nanjing, is still in disconnected state, and police in many places are deeply searching for Huang Xing along the disconnected area.

On July 10, 2020, the security branch of the Guermo Public Security Bureau of Haixi Province received a notification from a superior, that a student of a Nanjing University, Huang Zheng, was on a Z164 train from Nanjing to Guermo on July 5, and that the operator of the machine gun in the southwest area of Shimizu River at Sonan Dajie Protection Station in Qumale County, Yushu Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Qinghai Province, was lost on July 9, and requested assistance in locating it.
According to the investigation of the Guermo Public Security Bureau, Huang entered Qinghai on July 6 at 19:54, and arrived in Guermo at 4:00 on July 7.

At 8 a.m. on the same day, the uncoordinated personnel Mr. Huang left the Yellow River Hotel in Gorm City on the G109 National Highway by taxi, and arrived at the Cocos City Sonandajeh Protection Station at 12 a.m., the taxi driver returned alone, and Mr. Huang arrived at the Shimizu River area near Sonandajeh Protection Station at 15 a.m. on the 7th and allowed the airport to close at 18 a.m. on the 9th.
In further investigation, the police found that Mr. Huang passed through the Nogigou checkpoint at 17:07 on July 13.
The police can only search the road by car, coordinate with the Tibetan roadside checkpoints, and if they find Huang, they can immediately contact the Guermo Public Security Bureau.

According to the latest information, at 1 a.m. on July 26, the Guermo Public Security Bureau organized the rescue force to carry rescue equipment and go to the Unfrozen Spring Protection Station and Sonan Dajie Protection Station along the Qinghai-Tibet Highway for search and rescue.
The local police hope that the general netizens and the community have relevant clues, promptly to the Gulm police and Nanjing Jiangning police to try to find the unconnected person Huang Zhi.

At the same time, the experts advised that tourists should be standardized, rational and civilized when outdoor activities, pay attention to the roadside warning signs at all times, do not venture into uninhabited areas, and should report any emergency situations in a timely manner.
US media reveals the truth about the US's unjustified demand for China's closure of the consulate-general in Houston-Chinanews.net
The media has uncovered the truth about the US's unjustified demand that China close its consulate in Houston

On 24 April, the Chinese Foreign Ministry informed the US Embassy in China that China had decided to revoke the permit for the establishment and operation of the US Consulate General in Chengdu and made specific requests to the Consulate General to cease all operations and activities, as a countermeasure to the US abruptly requested China to close the Consulate General in Houston on 21 April.
The US government's actions have sparked widespread concern, and its political motivation has been questioned by outsiders and academics.
Why is China demanding the closure of the Consulate General?
It is not clear why the U.S. will choose the Chinese consulate in Houston, several foreign media said, but the purpose of the move, foreign media bluntly said: for the election.
CNN reported on 23 July that the move to ask China to close its consulate in Houston raised questions about its political motives.
The article said the US government's disastrous response to the new crown disease caused a relatively low turnout in the pre-election polls for President Donald Trump.

White House officials privately claim that China’s tough strategy is aimed at saving Trump’s approval ratings, as well as shifting responsibility for the White House’s failure to respond to the epidemic.

The article argued that the Chinese consulate in Houston was a "politically driven, very cautious" target chosen by the United States, which chose it "to create a hard line while avoiding the risk of major conflict".
The BBC also said that Trump believed that "playing the Chinese card has political advantages" as the US election season approached and the US economy was hit hard by the epidemic.
The current situation is a “ spiralling, confrontational struggle,” driven in part by the US government’s domestic considerations, which will only exacerbate tensions between the two countries.
CBS reported that Trump’s prospects for re-election were undermined by the outbreak, which he repeatedly blamed on China.
Almost every day, the US takes new action against Trump’s absurd rhetoric of “China exploiting America.”
"The Consulate General of Houston is very important in establishing ties between the two countries"
The Associated Press commented that the U.S. demand that China close its consulate in Houston has exacerbated tensions between the world's two largest economies.

If the Chinese Consulate-General in Houston were closed, China's citizens in the southern United States would face difficulties in obtaining consular services, as would American citizens seeking visas and other services, in addition to diplomatic implications.

A business group in Houston regretted the US demand for China to close its consulate in Houston, saying the consulate played an important role in establishing trade, investment and cultural ties between the two countries.
The Associated Press said this reflects the importance of China's economy.
The website of the US magazine Foreign Policy said the move was "part of a series of provocative moves that will only worsen US-China relations".

Jonathan Pollack, an expert on East Asia at the American think tank The Brookings Institution, quoted Reuters as saying that since the establishment of comprehensive diplomatic relations between the US and China in 1979, he could not think of any move that could be equated with the US action against China's consulate in Houston.
The South China Morning Post reported that the move was unprecedented in the more than 40 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
Analysts believe the move could cause lasting damage.
The Chinese Consulate-General in Houston was established in 1979, the first Chinese consulate to open in the United States.
Currently, China has one embassy and five consulates-general in the United States.
