2020 - Fully operational by 2020 - Official website

Xinhua News Agency (Jia Kailong) by wire dated July 26 issued a joint press release from the Political Work Department of the Military Commission and the Defense Mobilization Department of the Military Commission to deploy the recruitment of officers from ordinary university graduates in 2020.

This year, the direct recruitment of officers covers more than 270 general military-use specialties in 64 categories, including computers, automation and mechanics.The recruitment of specialties such as drones, navigation, aerospace, electronic information and small languages will be intensified, with nearly 2,000 recruits recruited compared to last year.
The recruitment of officers began on 1 August and ended on 30 September.

Applicants can check the conditions for recruiting officers directly and the distribution of professions recruited from all over the country through the National Recruiting Network (http://www.gfbzb.gov.cn), submit online application information that meets the professional scope and recruitment conditions, and participate in the subsequent recruitment work such as physical examination and political examination according to the uniform requirements of the recruiting military service organs.

Qualified young people who are not recruited as officers due to the restrictions on their specialties and plans may participate in the conscription of volunteers.When they are selected as officers after completing their compulsory military service, the number of years they have studied in ordinary institutions of higher learning according to the prescribed academic system shall be considered as the same as the period of service.

This year, recruitment of officers will be organized by the recruitment offices of the people's governments at the provincial or municipal levels.The specialties with high enrolment potential will be selected on the basis of comprehensive measurement of the enrolled persons' educational level, academic achievements during their studies, and obtaining professional qualification certificates.

According to the normalization of epidemic prevention and control requirements, this year the recruitment officers will not arrange to report themselves in principle, and will be transported to the camp in synchrony with the volunteers.
The direct recruitment period for officers will start on 1 September 2020, and the period for serving under the orders of the Forces will be 1 December 2020.

The units receiving the troops will scientifically formulate the enlistment and professional training programmes and carefully organize training; after the training is completed, recruiting officers will be uniformly and accurately assigned to the professional technical posts in the professional counterpart in accordance with the principle of professional counterpart and uniform recruitment.

Most of the areas of free nucleic acid testing in Urumqi have been basically completed Secondary testing in high risk areas - China New Media

(Reporter: Zhao Yamin) Zhang Wei, director of the city's health and safety committee, said on July 26 that most of the free nucleic acid testing in the city has been basically completed, while reporting on the latest epidemic and the testing of nucleic acid.

The State Council's expert group and experts from the autonomous regions and the city of Urumqi are making further assessments of the epidemic situation based on the results of nucleic acid testing and epidemiological investigations.
Xinjiang's Uighur Autonomous Region Information Office held a press conference on 26th to report on the epidemic and prevention and control situation in Xinjiang.
He said 22 new confirmed cases of new coronary pneumonia (of which 5 were confirmed as asymptomatic) and 38 asymptomatic cases were reported in Urumqi from 0:00 to 00:00 on July 25.
As of 24 July, there were 135 confirmed cases and 147 asymptomatic cases in Urumqi.
The 25th day of the new asymptomatic infections are also basically through the city free nucleic acid test, active screening.
Most of the free nucleic acid testing in the city of Urumqi has been basically completed, Zhang Wei, director of the city's health and safety committee, said on Sunday.

He added that, from experience in other parts of the country, there are many factors that influence the results of nucleic acid testing, such as the sensitivity of the test reagents, the time of infection and detoxification of the test subjects, the cooperation of the test subjects when samples are collected (the lack of cooperation may cause the samples not to be taken in place), the testing environment, the proficiency of the test subjects.
For various reasons, nucleic acid testing also produces false negative results.
The false negative is a test that indicates that the tested person is indeed infected, but the test results for nucleic acid are negative.
In addition, for persons who have had close contact with confirmed cases and suspected cases, it usually takes two nucleic acid tests to exclude.
For people who have been to high-risk areas, if fever and respiratory symptoms occur, a negative nucleic acid test may be false negative, so it also requires two nucleic acid tests to rule out.

In view of the above, he said, for the health of the people of all ethnic groups in the city, from today, the city of Urumqi will conduct a second free nucleic acid test in key areas such as Tianshan District, Shai Baq District, and also carry out "checking for residual leaks".
It is reported that Tianshan and Shai Baq are high-risk areas.

"No new cases of new coronary pneumonia confirmed in Dalian" (PDF).

Xinhua News Agency (Dalian, July 25) - Dalian City reported on July 25 that from 15:00 to 14:00 on July 24, there were no new confirmed cases of new coronary pneumonia in Dalian, 24 new cases of asymptomatic infection, and no new suspected cases.
From 22 to 25 July, at 14:00, the city reported 12 cases of new coronary pneumonia locally confirmed, all of them were treated in Dalian's Sixth People's Hospital in intensive isolation.

According to Zhao Lian, deputy director of Dalian City Health and Health Commission, Dalian City organized medical personnel from three-tier hospitals to live in street communities, opened more than 600 sampling points along Dalian Bay, Workers Village, light rail and some key areas of Jinpu New Area, and pushed hard to screen for nucleic acid, with nearly 2,000 medical personnel deployed daily to conduct nucleic acid testing and sampling.
By midnight on 25 July, the city had collected over 210,000 samples.

Of the 12 confirmed cases in Dalian, 10 were employees of Dalian Kaiyang World Seafood Co., Ltd.; 46 of the 54 asymptomatic cases were employees of the company and their relatives and families; and 85% of all positive cases were employees of the company and their relatives and families.

After the trial, Dalian City decided to tighten control over all close contacts of all employees of Dalian Kaiyang World Seafood Co., Ltd. and close contacts of close contacts, and to implement 14 days of centralized isolation medical observation and at least two tests for nucleic acid.

The city of Dalian also decided to further expand the scope of medical observation of the detainees in the central isolation, and to conduct 14 days of medical observation of the positive detainees (including cases and asymptomatic infections) and close contacts of the close contacts, and at least two tests of the nucleic acid.

The airport and railway stations in Dalian issued notices on 25th, and the city personnel in principle did not need to leave the station, and if they did, they had to have negative certificates of nitric acid testing within 7 days; the bus and passenger terminal in Dalian suspended all the city's routes from 12 o'clock on 25th, and the exact time of resumption was notified separately.
Brazilian study shows that hydrochlorobenzene is ineffective in the treatment of mild-to-moderate neo-Cranial pneumonia-CNS
A Brazilian study has shown that hydrochlorobenzene is not effective in patients with mild to moderate new coronary pneumonia.
The study was published in the New England Journal of Medicine.

The researchers divided 667 patients from 55 hospitals across the country into three groups and conducted clinical trials comparing the effects of hydrochlorobenzene alone or in combination with other antibiotics, achimycin, to see if it could improve the condition of mild and moderate patients with new coronary pneumonia.
The results showed that hydrochlorobenzene not only had no therapeutic effect but could cause harmful side effects on the organs.

The study was carried out by several Brazilian authoritative hospitals, such as Hospital Israelita Albert Einstein, Hospital for Cardiac Disease (HCor), Hospital Sírio-Libanês, and others, in collaboration with the Brazilian Clinical Research Institute (BCRI) and the Brazilian Network for Critical Care Research (BRICNet).
Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva announced on social media that his country's fourth nucleic acid test was negative.

Zhao Yijun, Taiwanese journalist
"The Fourth Round of App Governance in China: Protecting Personal Information Security".

The government has launched a campaign to control the illegal collection and use of personal information in 2020, focusing on cracking down on the strong public concerns about the private uploading of personal information from behind the scenes, Xinhua news agency reported on July 25 (reporters Yu Junjie and Chen Aiping) from the State Net Agency.

It is reported that this round of app management work is carried out by the State Network Communications Office, the Ministry of Labor and Communications, the Ministry of Public Security, and the State Administration of Market Supervision in four departments.

Last year, the special governance working group, composed of four departments, received more than 12,000 articles of information that users could effectively report, conducted checks on more than 2,300 apps, and took punitive measures such as public exposure, interviews and removal of the 260 apps that had large user sizes and outstanding problems.

According to the head of the National Network of Correspondents Office, the number of apps has exceeded 5 million, and the problem of illegally collecting and using personal information has not been solved at all.
In 2020, the governance will be further strengthened, and based on App verification, the governance scope will be further expanded to SDK (software development toolkit) and small programs, etc.

The working group will conduct a thematic study and in-depth testing on issues such as the collection of personal biometric information and the use of non-standardized and sensitive permissions for abuse of apps, focusing on back-end permission abuse such as recording and photography.

According to the seriousness of the circumstances and consequences of the problem, the Working Group will, in accordance with the law, impose punishments such as negotiation, warning, hanging, and fines, and act as an effective deterrent to violations.

It is understood that the working group plans to develop and publish guidelines for app store audit management, to urge app stores to effectively audit before the app goes online, and to tighten the entry barrier.
In addition, the Working Group will also release free technical tools to guide SMEs in self-assessment and enhance the legality of their personal information collection and use activities.

US-China Trade Representative Meets in August

China's trade negotiating team chief, Vice Premier Liu He, and the joint US team leader and trade representative, Lai Haizhe, are expected to hold formal talks in August to assess the two sides' implementation of the first-stage trade agreement with the United States, the South China Morning Post quoted an anonymous person familiar with the matter as saying on Sunday.

The report said that although China has increased its purchases of U.S. agricultural products substantially in the past few months, the amount of Chinese purchases is still a long way from the amount promised in the trade agreement, due to factors such as the outbreak of the new crop virus.
Analysts say the recent closure of US and Chinese consulates, coupled with other disputes, could undermine any progress in trade.

The first-stage trade agreement between China and the United States will come into effect one month after its signing on January 15. The agreement stipulates that a high-level trade framework group of the two sides should meet every six months.
The meeting will be an "important turning point" for both sides to assess the progress of the agreement, people familiar with the matter said.

But the man also said that if tensions between the US and China cause a lack of willingness to talk at this time, the two sides might agree to meet on a May 8 telephone meeting between Mr. Lai and Mr. Liu, which meets the terms of the trade agreement's six-monthly meeting.
Since this year, Sino-US relations have deteriorated rapidly, with disputes over the origin of the new crown virus, trade, Hong Kong, Xinjiang, the South China Sea and ideology among other issues.
US President Donald Trump, who boasted earlier this year of his achievements in the first-stage agreement, has recently changed his mind.

"This trade deal means less to me now than it did when it was made," he told reporters at the White House on 23 May, adding that China has recently bought a record number of US corns and soybeans on a daily basis.
An anonymous Beijing government adviser also said that the new round of trade talks was unlikely to take place because of the poor US-China relationship.

But he revealed that China’s economic and trade-related units were still meeting on the 23rd to discuss a range of issues, including how to increase imports from the US. “We have done our best to buy, so any additional purchases will be difficult.”

'It's more important than ever to keep the first-stage agreement alive,' said Vice President of the US-China National Trade Commission, Peter Penjening, who noted that China has made progress this year in further opening up financial markets to US companies.
"Talking is better than not talking, although it may be considered routine," said analyst Plenum, an independent research firm.

NASDAQ China Chief Representative Yusheng Hao: Now is the best time for Chinese companies to go to the U.S. for IPOs-Economic Watch-Specialized Financial News Website

China's stock market has been under pressure to back up its Chinese-listed stocks, with Netease and jingjing, among others, recently launching a bid to return to Hong Kong, due to tougher regulation of Chinese-listed stocks in the US, along with long-term valuation pressures, due to the faked coffee case of Ruikou.
And recently shell, ideal car and other companies, the enthusiasm to list in the United States rose.
Is this the best time for Chinese companies to go public in the US amid the epidemic and the Chinese stock market crisis?

"As far as the recent IPOs and the companies that are going to be listed in the US are concerned, the IPOs in the US have not been affected in any way, but the market is very good, and even now is the best time for Chinese companies to go to the US for IPOs in the last 10 years.
NASDAQ China Chief Representative Hao Yu-shing said at the "2020 Leaders' Summit of Listed Companies" held by Snowball.

In April, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Public Company Accounting Regulatory Commission (PCAOB) released a Statement on the Importance of Audit Quality and Regulatory Access to Audit and Other International Information – A Discussion on Current Information Access Challenges for US Listed Companies with Large Businesses in China.

The statement said that, despite significant increases in international cooperation and coordination in recent years, U.S. regulatory access to information remains problematic and that the SEC and PCAOB still face legal and practical challenges; in contrast, the PCAOB website lists listed companies with audit obstacles in detail, along with their auditing agencies, and a large number of listed companies.
In addition, in May, the Senate passed the Foreign Companies Accountability Act, which requires additional disclosure of information about foreign companies listed in the US.
In the eyes of Mr. Hao, the crisis in the Chinese stock market has not affected investors' appetite.

"The news scared everyone when it came out, and everyone was asking about the future of not being able to go public in the U.S., but then we found out that these questions were not on the investors side, that they might ask about them in their recent IPO tour of the U.S., and that they might even become standardized questions, but that they weren't seen as the key to investing in a Chinese company or not.
I suggest that we look at the current situation with a normal heart.
Of course, this may seem like the worst case in two years, but it hasn't affected investor appetite.
So the IPO boom will continue from now until the end of this year or before the U.S. elections.
On May 9, Jinshan Yun was officially listed on Nasdaq in the United States, becoming the first Chinese company to go to the US IPO after the outbreak.
"The listing of Jinshan Yun gives a lot of confidence to the Chinese companies that are preparing for IPOs later on.
"Hoo-Yung-Sheng says.
The first half of this year saw a total of 20 Chinese companies IPO in the US, up 17.6% from the same period last year, according to the China Overview of Shares data released by Snowball.

According to Mr. Hao, Chinese companies that go to IPO in the first half of this year are of high quality, and those with a solid basic and growth characteristics will be more attractive to investors.
In the short, medium and long term, Mr. Hao remains optimistic about Ming Chinese's IPO in the U.S.

In the short term, the IPO boom is still going on; in the medium term, Chinese companies have more options, A-shares, Hong Kong stocks, US stocks, and people will consider the U.S. election and the relationship between China and the U.S. as factors in the choice of market and timing; in the long term, everything will return to normal, market fluctuations are cyclical, both political and economic cycles, and eventually they will return to normal, the stock market has always been volatile.

"There are a lot of uncertainties this year, but for quality companies, whether the market is good or bad, as long as they are solid and have the growth that investors can see, the other factors are relatively minor, and investors need to invest in good Chinese companies," Mr. Hao said.

Xinhua News Agency (Chongqing) reported by wire on July 26 (journalists Zhou Wenchuang and Ke Gaoyang) that the government of the Wulong District of Chongqing City learned that heavy rains caused landslides and formed dams in the area, and more than 500 people were evacuated.

Due to the continuous rainfall, the landslide has been deformed in a large area since July 22, when the soil of the southern edge of the Zhongtai Group landslide in the Wulong District, a village in the Wulong District, was ruptured.

The storm caused a further increase in the landslide, which caused the village road to be blocked and completely blocked along the Cang River, forming a dam 13 meters in front of the dam and a reservoir with a capacity of about 420,000 cubic meters.

According to the site survey and monitoring, the landslide has a volume of about 1.3 million cubic meters and is still in an unstable state, with a few stones falling, the weir has overflowed the lake, there is a risk of breakwater, and poses a threat to downstream power stations and towns.
After the incident, the local government organized a night-long evacuation of residents along the river, urgently transferring the crowd to safety.
At present, 162 households and 520 people in the danger zone have been evacuated, and the disposal of the dam is still underway.
Reuters: Alibaba founder Ma Yun was summoned to India court

According to the report, an Indian employee who worked for Alibaba's UC browser sued the company for objecting to the company's application censorship system and false messaging content, and was fired.
The employee also took a few screenshots as evidence that showed Alibaba's UC News app publishing fake news about India, especially the headlines.
He also said an application called UC Web would examine content that contained such keywords as the Sino-Indian border and the Sino-Indian war.

The court documents show that civil judges in a local court in Gurugram, New Delhi's satellite city, have issued summons to Alibaba, Ma Yun and more than a dozen individuals or companies to appear on July 29 or through lawyers.

People's Daily Commentator: Focus on doing your own thing and building new advantages for future development - On learning to implement the keynote speech by the President-in-Office at the Entrepreneur Forum - Xinhua News Agency
Xinhua, July 25, 2007 People's Daily, July 26, 2007 Focus on your own business and build new advantages for future development
At present, the global epidemic situation and the world economic situation are still severe and complex, and the challenges facing our country's development are unprecedented.
Maintaining strategic strength, enhancing confidence in winning and concentrating on doing our own thing are the keys to meeting all kinds of risk challenges.

At the recent entrepreneurs' symposium, the Chinese President stressed that in the current external environment of rising protectionism, sluggish world economy and shrinking global markets, we must concentrate our efforts to do our own thing, give full play to the advantages of the domestic super-large market, gradually form a new development pattern with the domestic large-scale cycle as the main body and the domestic international dual cycle mutually promoted, upgrade the modernization level of the chain of industries supply chain, vigorously promote scientific and technological innovation, accelerate the key core technology offensive, and build new advantages for future development.
The seeker of the potential, the master of the potential wins.
In the external environment of the deep development of economic globalization, market and resources "without the two heads" play an important role in the rapid development of China.
Now, the world is undergoing profound changes, facing more instability and uncertainty, and economic globalization is facing headwinds and reversals.

One of the most important aspects of preparing for the long-term response to the changes in the external environment and preparing for the work to push our economy to break through the winds and to make steady progress is to make the expansion and meeting of domestic demand the strategic base of development, to give full play to our own advantages, to add impetus to our economic development through the prosperity of our domestic economy and the smooth passage of the domestic cycle, and to promote the world economic recovery.
We should realize that building a complete system of domestic demand is related to the long-term development and long-term security of our country.

The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China has clearly stated the timeliness and urged the firm implementation of the strategy of expanding domestic demand, which is the need to respond to the impact of the epidemic, to maintain the long-term and sustainable healthy development of our economy, and to meet the people's growing need for a better life.
The advantage of a large economy is internal recycling.

China has the world's most complete and largest industrial system, strong production capacity and perfect supporting capacity, more than 100 million market entities and more than 170 million people with higher education or various professional skills, and an ultra-large domestic demand market of 1.4 billion people, including more than 400 million middle-income groups.

The basic socialist economic systems such as the socialist market economy system, which have the public ownership system as their main subject and various ownership systems as their common development, and which have the distribution of labor as their main subject and various distribution methods coexist, can not only stimulate the vitality of various market subjects, liberate and develop social productivity, but also promote efficiency and fair organic unification and achieve constant common prosperity.

We should firmly grasp the strategic basis of expanding domestic demand, make the production, distribution and circulation of all the links more rely on the domestic market to achieve a virtuous cycle, clarify the strategic direction of supply-side structural reform, and promote a dynamic balance between total supply and total demand at a higher level.

We must accelerate the construction of a complete system of domestic demand, vigorously promote scientific and technological innovation and other innovations in all aspects, accelerate the advancement of strategic emerging industries such as the digital economy, intelligent manufacturing, life and health, and new materials, and form more new growth points and growth poles, and gradually form a new development pattern that is driven by the domestic large-scale cycle and promoted by the domestic and international dual cycles.
Openness brings progress, but closedness is bound to lag behind.
The Chinese President has repeatedly stressed that China's open door will not close, but only the bigger the door.

Taking the domestic cycle as the main subject, we should not close the door to close the operation, but achieve stronger and more sustainable development by making better connection between domestic and international markets, making better use of both domestic and international markets and resources.

At the same time, expanding domestic demand and expanding openness are not contradictory.The smoother the domestic cycle, the more favorable it is to construct a new open pattern and the more favorable it is to form new advantages in participating in international cooperation and competition.

Although the international trend of protectionism is rising, we should stand on the right side of history, insist on deepening reform, expanding openness, strengthening open cooperation in the field of science and technology, promoting the construction of an open world economy and building a community of human destiny.
The Chinese nation has experienced many hardships in its history, but has never been crushed. Instead, it has grown up and risen from the hardships with more courage.

On the way forward, we must have the strong leadership of the Central Committee of the Party, with Comrade Xi Jinping as its core, the remarkable advantages of the socialist system with Chinese characteristics, the strong mobilization capability and comprehensive strength, and the unity and struggle of the entire Party and the entire army of the people of all ethnic groups.

APEC Trade Ministers Meeting to Accelerate Regional Economic Recovery - Official website

Xinhua news agency, in Kuala Lumpur, said on July 25 (Ring Hao) that the video conference of APEC trade ministers promised to work to reduce the impact of the new crop disease on the region's economy and accelerate the achievement of a resilient, sustainable and inclusive regional economic recovery.
The meeting was hosted by Malaysia, the host of this year's APEC Leaders' Informal Meeting.

A joint statement issued after the meeting said APEC trade ministers recognized the importance of a free, open, equitable, non-discriminatory, transparent and predictable trading and investment environment for economic recovery at this challenging time.

The parties undertake to ensure that emergency measures taken to respond to the epidemic are targeted, appropriate, transparent and temporary, and do not create unnecessary trade barriers and disrupt global supply chains, while complying with WTO rules.

In the statement, APEC trade ministers pledged to strengthen cooperation to facilitate the flow of essential goods and services, promote interconnection and interconnection by enhancing supply chain flexibility, and minimize disruptions to the flow of medical supplies, food and agricultural products to respond to the epidemic.

APEC trade ministers agreed on the need to discuss how to reduce non-tariff barriers that restrict the trade in essential goods and reaffirmed their commitment to facilitating the necessary cross-border movement of people without affecting measures taken to prevent the spread of the epidemic.
The Conference also issued a declaration on facilitating the flow of essential commodities.

The declaration states that economies will ensure that their trade measures to respond to the epidemic are in line with WTO rules and commits to take action to reduce non-tariff barriers to trade and promote trade in order to facilitate the flow of goods necessary in the event of the epidemic.

Malaysian Minister of International Trade and Industry Azmin Ali, who chaired the meeting, said that despite the impact of the epidemic, Malaysia remains committed to making this year's APEC meeting a success and that work on the post-2020 cooperation vision is moving forward in an orderly manner.
Malaysia agreed to hold APEC-related meetings in video format, but did not rule out the possibility of organizing an entity meeting at the end of the year at the informal meeting of APEC leaders.

"France to increase military space deployment".

France will add hundreds of millions of euros to its space defense budget, France’s defense minister, France’s François Pali, said on Thursday, to develop a space military force to guard against “unfriendly actions” by other countries in outer space.

Parry told the Provence newspaper that the budget for France's space military project spending for the period 2019–2025 would increase from €3.6 billion ($4.2 billion) to €4.3 billion ($5.0 billion) from the previous estimate.

Under the French Military Planning Act 2019–2025, approved by the French Parliament in 2018, France is expected to upgrade its existing observation and communication satellites, launch three electromagnetic reconnaissance satellites, and upgrade its space surveillance radar.
French President Emmanuel Macron announced last July that the French Air Force would establish a military space command and an "Air and Space Force".
Parry said she would officially announce the formation of the space force when she visited a military school in the Provence region of Salon later that day.
Parry said the space force is part of the Air Force and will have 500 personnel by 2025.
"Space was once thought to serve the common interests of science, and that idea is no longer valid. Today, it is a place where nations compete for global hegemony," she said.
Parry reiterated Macron's earlier statement that the French had no intention of launching an arms race.
"We are not engaged in an arms race, but it is my responsibility to fully identify the threats we may face.
Parry recalled the surveillance of a French-Italian military satellite in 2017.
She said the spy was a Russian satellite.
The Russians denied this claim.
Parry said France would soon have small patrol satellites that could detect and track down "the moles behind those unfriendly actions".
French media have attributed France’s quest for a space force to US President Donald Trump’s February request to the US Department of Defense to draft a space force bill.
Trump signed the Defense Authorization Act last December, approving the creation of the US’s sixth-largest military, the Space Force.
Some experts fear that the US moves have accelerated the pace of US space militarization and could trigger a new space arms race.

Xinhua News Agency (Xinhua News Agency) in Hohe Hao, July 26 (Jia Lijun) reporters in the Yellow River Hubbard Water Resources Center Administration learned that the Hubbard Water Resources Center has been actively resolving the second flood this year for several days. As of the afternoon of July 26, the upstream inflow and outflow of water levels, monitoring data are normal, the flood is passing smoothly through the Wuhai section of the Yellow River Inner Mongolia.

In response to the flooding, the Huanghe Haibwan Waterworks in Wuhai City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, gradually lowered the reservoir level from 0:00 on July 23, and the discharge of the reservoir flow was controlled at a rate of not more than 3,000 cubic meters per second, until the water level before the dam dropped to 1,071 meters, releasing the reservoir capacity.
At the same time, start the sand removal scheduling application.

For several days, the Huanghe Haibo Bay Waterworks Authority has been closely monitoring the water situation and the development of flood season 24 hours a day, strengthening the operation of the reservoir and dam safety management, and strengthening the inspection and protection of the banks around the reservoir and important parts, especially the hazardous work sections, to ensure the safety of floods.

At 17:00 on 26 July, the Hub Bay Waterworks Centre had a discharge rate of 2760 cubic metres per second into the reservoir, 2760 cubic metres per second out of the reservoir, and a water level of 1071.5 metres before the dam.

At present, the floodgate dam section, earthen dam section and tailings slope are normal, and the monitoring data fluctuate within the normal range.The Yellow River flooding No.2 this year is passing smoothly through the Wuhai section of Inner Mongolia.

China's share-sharing market fell 72.1% year-on-year in the first five months of 2020, according to China's Shared Accommodation Development Report 2020 (the Report), released by the China Center for Sharing Economics (CCSE), a national information center, the Xinhua News Agency (Xinhua News Agency).

(Yong Fushan, Zhang Shushan, Xu Jing-ching) On July 25, the Chinese Navy Medical University signed a contract with the University of Xiamen's Zhongshan Hospital for Angio-vascular Surgery to establish a joint center to promote exchange and cooperation in the field of angio-vascular surgery, especially in the acute aortic disease.

The hospitals will establish a long-distance consultation service, develop treatment plans with Changhai Hospital, send trained personnel for further training, and jointly conduct weekly surgical technology exchange and classroom visits. For complicated cases, Changhai experts can be invited to perform surgery according to patients' needs, thus ensuring that patients in southwest Minnan can enjoy the best medical resources in China without having to travel to a province, the hospital said.
The two hospitals will also work together to carry out innovative surgical research, aortic diseases and early screening, etc.
The Aortic Seminar, sponsored by Beijing Health Promotion Association and sponsored by Xiamen University's Zhongshan Hospital, was held in Xiamen on the same day.

The two famous hospitals in Shanghai and Xia held a signing ceremony of the Angio-Surgical Collaboration Center at the same time, and announced that they had formed a collaborative unit to jointly improve the treatment of angio-surgical-related diseases in the southwest of Minnan.

The Angio-vascular Surgery Department of Shanghai Changhai Hospital is the only Angio-vascular Surgery Institute in the army and the only Clinical Medical Center for Diseases of the Angio-vascular System in Shanghai. It is also the first major department of Angio-vascular Surgery in China.
Professor Huang Xiaojin, Director of Angiovascular Surgery, Zhongshan Hospital, Xiamen University, was interviewed by the media.

The first hospital in the United States to offer a full-service medical care service to the general public, the University of California, Berkeley Hospital, was established in 2018 to provide a full-service medical care service to the general public.
In the treatment of aortic diseases, besides the treatment of dissecting aneurysms and aortic aneurysms, we have extensive experience in the diagnosis of ruptured aneurysms.

"The history of vascular surgery at Xiamen University's Zhongshan Hospital has been a long one.The range, difficulty and complexity of the operations are very outstanding in this region.We have established a collaborative center to conduct all-round cooperation in medicine, teaching and research in addition to the aorta, lower extremity and cervical arteries," he said.
Professor Feng Rui, vice director of vascular surgery at Shanghai Changhai Hospital, said.
In 2018, the University of Xiamen's Zhongshan Hospital and Shanghai Changhai Hospital signed a contract to establish a digestive medicine "Li Zhaoxing Namiang Medical Studio".
The director of the department, Professor Huang Xiaojin, told reporters on CNN that the department also has long-standing ties with Changhai Hospital.

He said the hospital would regularly invite Shanghai experts to Xiamen to conduct exchanges of surgical techniques, conduct classroom visits, discuss suspected cases, and further develop remote consultations.

The reporters learned that vascular disease is the first major cause of death in China. The aorta, as the main artery of all organs of the human body, plays an important role from the heart to the whole body.
The aorta is the largest section of the body, with a diameter of up to 4 cm, and is at high risk of bleeding if an aneurysm develops, ruptures, or if the endothelium ruptures, causing a septum.

In recent years, with the change of people's lifestyle and the acceleration of the pace of life, China has become the world's largest country for high blood pressure, and aortic diseases have increased accordingly. Today, with the development of surgical technology and industrial materials, the treatment of aortic diseases is continuously developing in the direction of minimally invasive, rapid and efficient.

Doctors can achieve good results by piercing the leg and placing a stent in the aorta to "translate" the blood flow, thus avoiding impact on an aneurysm or ruptured septum, and some operations even require local anesthesia.

The seminar invited more than 10 experts from China to discuss the new advances in the treatment of aortic diseases, and held a conference salon to conduct advanced technology training and discuss cases of suspected aortic diseases.

The reporters learned that with the development of surgical technology and industrial materials, the treatment of aortic diseases is continuously developing in the direction of micro-injury, rapid and efficient.

The longest high-speed rail tunnel in the Three Gorges Reservoir Area - China New Network
Author: Chen Haifeng Editor in charge: Chen Haifeng
The picture shows the construction site of the Little Three Gorges Tunnel.
CTR Chengdu Group Company for the drawing

(Han Lu)A reporter from the Chengdu Railway Corporation Ltd. was informed on July 26 that the 13.9 kilometer long Zheng Wan High-Speed Railway Little Three Gorges Tunnel will pass through the entire line on the day.

It is understood that the Xiao Three Gorges Tunnel is not only the longest high-speed tunnel in the Three Gorges Reservoir Area, but also the longest single-hole double-track high-speed tunnel designed to reach 350 km/h in the current domestic projects under construction.

The Zheng Wan High-Speed Railway (Zheng Wan HSR) is located in Henan, Hubei, and Chongqing, and connects Beijing-Guangzhou and Xulan high-speed railways in northern Zhengzhou, and connects Yunnan-Zhoushan high-speed railway in southern Manchuria to Chongqing.
The entire route of the Zheng Wan high-speed railway is crossed by the Little Three Gorges Tunnel on 26th.
The picture shows the scene.

The new high-speed railway line from Zhengzhou, Henan Province, to the southwest, via Pingdingshan, Nanyang, Xiangyang, Hubei Province to Wanzhou, Chongqing, is about 818 km long, with a design speed of 350 km/h, and about 184 km within Chongqing.
The first phase of the project, from Zhengzhou to Xiangyang, was completed on December 1, 2019, and construction of the Chongqing section is underway.

The newly constructed railway line is located at the junction of the two main highways, the railway line from the town of Chongqing to the town of Wushan, and is approximately 18.9 km long and 890 m deep.
Construction of the tunnel began in February 2017 and the line will be completed on 26 July 2020.

According to Wang Guojun, the head of the design of the Zheng Wan High-Speed Tunnel, China Central Railway Secondary School Engineering Group Co., Ltd., the site of the Xiao Three Gorges Tunnel is a high-risk tunnel of Class I, with very complex geological conditions and risks of rock dissolution, mudslides, soft rock deformation, and difficulty in tunnel design and construction.

"In the course of the project construction, we used geological survey, physical exploration and drilling methods to predict the geology of the tunnels, and adopted special design schemes for more than 30 types of tunnels. We designed and built 24m long bridges, crossed tunnels with longitudinal lengths of more than 10m and depths of more than 55m, and avoided tunnel sinking," the Royal Army said.

According to the construction party, the Central Railway Tunnel Bureau, the tunnel construction, adopted the combination of the tunnel opening and closing, through the construction of horizontal tunnel opening, slurry closing, strengthening the tunnel structure support and construction of sewage treatment station, not only ensured the orderly advancement of the project, but also avoided the construction drainage to the water body of the Small Three Gorges scenic area, while successfully overcoming the bad geology such as the long 7 km of soft rock large deformation, the multi-tipped mud flooding with the maximum daily flow of 15.7 million cubic meters.

After the completion of the Zheng Wan high-speed railway, it will become a new convenient and fast passenger main corridor connecting the southwest of China to the Central Plains, northern China and northeastern China.It is of great significance to improve the capacity and quality of the northeastern and southwest railway corridors, improve the layout of the regional road network, accelerate the development of tourism resources and urbanization along the line, promote regional coordination and development, and promote the implementation of the strategy of large-scale development of the western region.
Experts say the collection of immigration data through the U.S. Census for the distribution of seats in the House is unconstitutional

Some civil rights groups and several US cities and counties have filed lawsuits against the federal government, claiming that the Trump administration's attempts to exclude undocumented immigrants from the US census were both unconstitutional and ineffective.
The United States Census will determine the distribution of seats in the United States House of Representatives.
"It's not going to work," Sarah Brannon, executive attorney for the Civil Rights Freedoms Association of America, told VOA.
She went on to say that Trump's demands for a census to determine the citizenship of those who are being surveyed are difficult to achieve and "not very reliable."
Another civil-rights group, the Common cause, filed a lawsuit Thursday challenging Trump’s executive order.
Several cities in New Jersey and Georgia joined the suit.
Arlington County, Virginia, joined the suit Friday.

"The U.S. Constitution requires us to accurately count our population every 10 years. We must accurately count everyone who lives in Arlington County," said Gary Garvey, chairman of Arlington County's board of directors. "This illegal attempt to scare away and reduce the number of our immigrant communities cannot succeed.
Other organizations and individuals have praised President Trump’s executive orders.
Alabama Attorney General Marshall called the executive order a "victory" for the state.

"The allocation of seats in the House of Representatives and the Electoral College in each state must be based on the number of residents who live in the states and the number of residents who are legal residents," he said.
The US Supreme Court last year prevented the Trump administration from including citizenship in the 2020 census.

President Donald Trump signed an executive order earlier this week directing US Census Bureau Trade Secretary Robert Ross to submit census-collected data on undocumented populations to the administration to exclude them from state census figures, thereby determining whether each state will increase or decrease its seats in the House of Representatives.
The United States redistributes its seats every 10 years to reflect demographic changes.

Employment and Prices Show the Economy Has a "Temperature"
China Daily News, China Economic Network.

In the first half of this year, faced with the impact of the new crown pneumonia epidemic, China has been coordinating efforts to promote epidemic prevention and control and economic and social development.The situation of epidemic prevention and control has been steadily improving, the steady recovery of the economy is evident, employment and prices, which are closely related to people's livelihoods, have generally been stable, and the Chinese economy has submitted a warm economic performance report.
In the first two months of this year, the survey unemployment rate rose.

In February, in particular, many enterprises' production and operations were essentially in a state of shutdown, demand for workers decreased, recruitment was delayed or cancelled, and the urban unemployment rate rose.
With the gradual improvement of the situation of epidemic prevention and control, the order of production and life of the whole society is being restored.

The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China has insisted on a stable overall baseline for its work, further strengthened macroeconomic policy countermeasures, strengthened employment priority policies in a comprehensive manner, and actively promoted the work of supporting enterprises to secure and expand employment.

China has increased its policy to hedge against job insecurity, and has launched a policy package of "deductions and exemptions and re-supplying the job", phased out the payment of three social insurance units, allowed the delay in paying social insurance contributions, expanded the return of unemployment insurance to small and medium-sized enterprises, and provided benefits from the worker-on-the-job training policy, subsidized enterprises to absorb key groups of employment, and subsidized apprenticeships, etc.

With the implementation of various employment-secure policies, demand for workers in enterprises steadily rose, the employment situation gradually improved, and the urban unemployment rate declined gradually.

Zhang Yi, director of the Population and Employment Statistics Division of the National Bureau of Statistics, said that employment policies continued to be effective in the second quarter.Labor workers who had left the country due to the epidemic in the previous quarter were gradually returning, and the urban labor participation rate rose by about 10 percentage points in June compared with February, close to the level of the same period last year.

The figures show that the total number of jobs in urban areas rose more than 19% in June compared to February, most industries reached the pre-epidemic level, and the average weekly working hours of enterprise employees reached 46.8 hours, up 6.6 hours from February and slightly higher by 0.1 hours from January.
Prices also affect thousands of households.
In January, the CPI rose 5.4% year-on-year, a record high for many years.
In February, year-on-year CPI growth, though slightly lower, remained in the “Five-Way Zone.”
The year-on-year increase in CPI was high, driven by both the consumption demand before the Spring Festival and the low base figures and the wrong month of the Spring Festival.
However, the effect of the new crown pneumonia epidemic on prices is particularly obvious.

In January and February, the epidemic was affected by logistics delays, inadequate supply of materials, and rising transport costs.In addition, some residents hoarded and looted, and some essentials prices rose significantly.

In order to cope with the disturbance caused by the epidemic prevention and control to the price situation, the relevant departments have included important living materials in the scope of emergency transportation protection to ensure the smooth transportation of materials.
Under the influence of a series of policy measures, the supply of vegetables and fruits in the market is strongly guaranteed.

In response to the rapid rise in pigmeat prices at the beginning of this year, the Central Government has issued a policy of price stability for the supply and demand of pigmeat, and implemented it promptly in all regions and departments.

Since March, pig prices have been falling steadily, leading to a year-on-year increase in food prices of 10.6% in May.In June, pig prices rose slightly in the round-robin, due to slower piglets, reduced imports and a rise in demand for group consumption.
The seasonal variation in the price of fresh vegetables was evident, rising by an average of 3.4 per cent in the first half.
The average annual price of fresh fruit fell 13.3% in the first half of the year, due to the higher base figure compared to the same period last year.
The basic life of the masses is effectively guaranteed and the economic and social situation remains stable and orderly.
With the gradual resumption of transport logistics, the strength of supply and demand insurance has been increased in various places, and the market supply and demand situation has improved.
The CPI fell for four consecutive months in March, and year-on-year growth fell from 4.3 per cent in March to 2.5 per cent in June, as prices generally recovered.

In the second half of the year, prices will remain moderate and overall inflationary pressure will be moderate, but we must continue to restore order in production and life on the premise that epidemic prevention and control are normalized.

We will effectively respond to natural disasters such as flooding and drought in the main producing areas of agricultural products such as grains, fruits and vegetables, strengthen market supervision and resolutely combat acts such as hoarding and speculation, and inflating prices that disturb market order.

Departments actively implement flood prevention measures to ensure transport safety - China New Internet
China has been hit by heavy rainfall in many places since the beginning of the summer, Xinhua news agency said by wire on July 26.

To do a good job of flood prevention and transportation safety, all departments will hold their posts, strengthen the investigation and control of hidden dangers, intensify emergency management, and implement flood prevention measures in a comprehensive manner.

According to the latest statistics from China National Railway Group Co., Ltd., the railway department has deployed more than 280,000 inspectors, inspected more than 90,000 bridges, 17,000 tunnels and 240,000 culverts.

Since July 1, the main trunk lines and freight corridors of the national railways have been kept safe and smooth, and overall transport order has been good, with the start, operation and arrival of passenger trains directly through the railway bureaus reaching 97.7%, 87.1% and 86.8% respectively.

The Nanchang Railway Administration Group Co., Ltd. has been strengthening emergency management by dispatching specialized personnel to monitor and control the flood control equipment, road materials reserves and storage, and to promptly communicate information and initiate emergency response in the event of sudden disaster failure.

In the recent past, in the face of the security threat posed by heavy rainfall that caused the upstream formation of weir dam lake to the Qingjiang Bridge of Yi Wan Railway, the Yichang Comprehensive Maintenance Section of Wuhan Railway Bureau Co., Ltd. organized professional technicians to monitor the Qingjiang Bridge 24 hours a day and established a 24-hour communication mechanism with local emergency departments to grasp and deal with the dangers in a timely manner.

To ensure the safety of electricity for summer transportation, the Qingdao Power Supply Company of the State Grid, namely the Mekong Region, in close cooperation with the local meteorological and railway departments, will strengthen inspection and investigation of potential hazards on railway power lines and facilities in the district, and will strengthen emergency management of related accidents such as landslides, landslides and mudslides in the line corridors.

To further improve flood control and counter-earthquake countermeasures, Orient Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. has set up a contingency and rescue reserve team, conducted flood control and disaster prevention knowledge training, and formulated flight plans according to daily weather and typhoon warning, etc., to make good preparations and related contingency plans for the operation and recovery of aircraft parked in coastal areas.

Inter Inter unlocks 3000th Serie A match - CSN
The match was played on 26 July at the Stade Français de Paris, where Milan have won the title.
According to Italian media, the away match against Genoa was the 3,000th appearance of Inter in the Serie A, and the Blacks were the first team to break the record.
Since the 1929 league reform, Inter have been the only team to never miss the Serie A and the only team to never be relegated.
According to Italian media, Inter vs. Genoa was the 3000th match of the Blacks' history.
In this milestone match, Inter won the match against Genoa in a 3 - 0 away win.
Lucascoumé scored twice in the game, and Sánchez, who had substituted for the defender, also scored a goal.
The match started at the pace of Inter Milan, and the attack was finally converted into a goal in the 34th minute.
Biagi left-handed, Lukaku midfielder took the header and broke the goal.

In the 82nd minute, Inter fired a pass from Mossi on the right, which Sánchez took on the right-hander, and before the end of the game, Lukaku scored a second goal, but was repulsed by Brozovic, who sent him a long-range pass.
Inter Milan have won 3–0 away to Genoa, taking the score from Atlanta to 2nd place, 4 points behind the leading side Juventus in a multi-match series, but still have hope of winning the title.
In the 3,000 league appearances that spanned almost 90 seasons, Inter won 1,489 of them, tied 834 and lost 677, with a winning percentage of 49.6%.
The team scored 5,038 goals and lost 3,102, scoring 1.68 goals in the game.
The club has won the league 18 times and never lost a league title.

On July 26, Greenland Holdings (600606.SH) issued a "Guidance Notice on the Transfer of Shares of the Company by Publicly Collecting the Transferee" and "Relicensing of Shares".

The announcement shows that, in order to further deepen the reform of state-owned state-owned enterprises, optimize the restructuring of the state-owned structure and improve the shareholding structure of Greenland, Shanghai Estate (Group) Limited (hereinafter referred to as Shanghai Estate) and Shanghai City Investment (Group) Limited (hereinafter referred to as Shanghai City Investment) intend to transfer part of the shares held by the company by publicly collecting the shares of the transferee.

The price of the proposed shares shall not be less than the higher of: the arithmetic average of the weighted average daily price for the 30 trading days preceding the date of the notice (27 July 2020); and the net asset value per share of the company audited in the most recent accounting year.

At present, there is no consensus on the new strategic investors for Greenland, and according to the estimates of the announcement, the new strategic investors to take the 17.5% stake in the greenland in the mixed transfer of the need to pay about 14 billion yuan of funds.

It is noteworthy that after the transfer of shares, it is expected that Greenland will still have no controlling shareholders and actual controllers, but the control structure may change significantly.

The company has undergone several institutional reforms since its inception: from 1992 to 1997, it operated under a pure state-owned system in accordance with marketization rules; from 1997 to 2013, it established and continuously improved the shareholding system of state-owned holdings and employee-owned shares; from 2013 to 2015, it introduced strategic investors, forming a mixed ownership system of cross-ownership and mutual integration of state-owned and non-public capital; from 2015 to date, it has been listed as a public company.
In December 2019, Gaoling Capital took over a 15% stake in GREE (000651.SZ) from Zhuhai Mingjun for $416.62 billion.

Zhang Yuliang, chairman of Greenland Holdings and president of the Shanghai City Investment Corporation, said that the move is an important step in Shanghai to promote comprehensive reform of state-owned state-owned enterprises and accelerate the reform of state-owned state-owned enterprises in a new phase, in accordance with the demands of the Central Committee of the Shanghai Communist Party.

The playground was smashed and the children went to the school after they got their money back
<unk>?Chief Correspondent, Zhao Yifan
Xiao Wen, 3, was playing in a college playground when he was hit in the head by a baseball player from the Yankees.
After the court ordered the school to pay the damages, the school's attorney, Mr. Wen, sued the school for damages and paid $20,000 in medical expenses and psychological damages.

Recently, the Haidian District People's Court of Beijing has dismissed the plaintiff's claim after considering that the school had set up a safety net on the playground at the time of the incident and had fulfilled its duty to provide adequate safety protection, and that Chen had made compensation.
Mr. Wen alleged that during the summer vacation of 2019, he and Mr. Wen were playing on the school playground while the baseball team was training on the playground.
To avoid the risks, Mr. and Mrs. Wen and many other children and parents are allowed to play in the safe areas designated by the baseball team.
However, the player who was on the base, Chen Sung, took off his hand while throwing, causing the baseball to fly over the net into the above-mentioned safety zone and hit Xiao Wen's backside.
Mr. Wen immediately took Xiao Wen to the hospital for treatment, was diagnosed with a head injury.
Mr Wen said the facilities of the school grounds did not meet the relevant safety regulations and did not manage the teams and related facilities effectively.

The school's negligence caused the above-mentioned incidents, which caused the minor to suffer great pain both physically and mentally, and also brought great pain to his family, and the school should bear legal responsibility for this.

The school argues that the school has set up a safety net at the playground and posted management regulations and training notices, telling children to stay away from the playground and reminding them to be safe, and the plaintiff cannot prove that the school "does not meet its obligations to ensure safety" and therefore does not agree to compensation.
The court held that the school's management of the playground was subject to the security obligation, but that the school's security obligation could only be met by the general duty of care.

The school had set up a safety net on the playground at the time of the incident, and had done its best to ensure proper safety, and Chen Shang also made a compensation agreement with Xiao Wen for medical expenses, transportation costs and other losses of more than 2,000 yuan, the two parties agreed to settle the dispute once.
The school's decision was rejected by the court, which ruled that the plaintiff had not been able to pay the full amount of the damages.
No appeal was filed against the decision, and the case is now pending.

According to Article 37 of the Law on tort liability, schools, as the managers of public places, have the obligation to ensure safety.In the event that the acts of a third party cause damage to others, the third party shall bear the tort liability, and the managers of public places who fail to meet their safety obligations shall bear the corresponding supplementary liability.

The judge said that since as the manager of a public place, it is most likely to know the actual situation of the whole place, foresee the risks and damages that may occur, and thus most likely to take necessary measures to prevent the occurrence of losses or mitigate the extent of damages, and the cost of avoiding and mitigating damages is the lowest, the law stipulates that it must undertake corresponding guarantee obligations in carrying out social activities.

In the present case, the obligation of security for the school should be adapted to the social activities it engages in, especially the basic security measures and the obligation to inform about the hidden dangers, for the non-specific access of the school to the public free of charge.
In judicial practice, it is also not appropriate to impose excessive safety guarantee obligations on public place managers.

If the school has already adopted the establishment of the protection network and has done its duty to inform, it can be determined that the school has no fault and should not bear legal responsibility.

In addition, even if the manager of a public place such as a school fails to meet his obligation to ensure safety, his liability for third party infringement is also a supplementary compensation for damages.
Therefore, in such accidents, the victim should not extend the scope of claims after having received compensation from the directly infringing party.

Yang Hung-nian, founder of Beijing Love Choir, passed away at the age of 86 - China News

Yang Hong-nian, founder of the Beijing Philharmonic Choir, a renowned Chinese conductor, music educator, lifelong academic member of the Central Academy of Music and professor of the Department of Conducting, passed away at the age of 86 on July 26, 2020 at 13:55 in Beijing, Xinjing Daily News (Chinese) (Chinese reporter Liu Zhen) said on July 26, 2020.
The picture is from the official website of Beijing Philharmonic Orchestra.
Yang Hong was born in 1934 in Nanjing, Jiangsu, and has been a keen music lover since childhood.

In 1951, he was appointed to the choir of the Nanjing People's Radio and in the fall of 1951 he entered the music department of Shanghai Eastern Normal University, where he studied composition and re-tune with Professor Yang Jia Ren and German conductor Hezman.
In 1958 he was appointed to the Department of Music at Beijing Normal Academy of Arts, and in 1973 he was transferred to the Department of Composition and Conducting at the Central Music Academy.
In 1983, Yang Hong founded the Beijing Love Choir.
For more than 30 years, he has led the choir around the world, and won dozens of awards in important competitions at home and abroad.
He has conducted over 30 groups including the Central Choir, the Central National Choir, the Oriental Choir, and the Shanghai Choir, and has conducted many symphonic and choral concerts.

The book includes a collection of songs written by children, a collection of essays on the problem of choral alignment, a symphonic hierarchy of orchestral music, and a translation of the choral instrumentation and the harmonic language of Debussy.

Israel Strengthens Repeated Prevention and Control of Epidemic - China New Media
Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Wang Sishou
Israel Strengthens Repeated Prevention and Control of Epidemics
In the early stages of the outbreak of the new crown pneumonia, Israel's preventive and control measures were effective.

However, with the gradual lifting of the ban, the number of new cases of CJD diagnosed in Israel has increased significantly in recent years and the Israeli Government has taken emergency measures to strengthen the prevention and control of the epidemic on several occasions.

On 28 February, the first case of new coronary pneumonia was diagnosed in Israel, prompting the closure of all ports of entry and exit, suspension of unnecessary industries, the switch to online teaching in schools, restrictions on public transport and unnecessary social activities, the blockade of cities in serious epidemic condition, joint military-police efforts to maintain control and prevention.
The series of measures quickly proved to be successful, and by mid-May, Israel had once again reduced the number of new cases of new coronary pneumonia diagnosed to one per day.
As the epidemic was brought under control, Israeli measures to prevent and control it were lifted, and since June the number of new cases of pneumonia had gradually rebounded.
Especially after July, the spread of the epidemic has been accelerating.
The number of new cases in Israel has been increasing by more than 1,500 every day for eight days. As of the date of the July 25 release, the number of new cases on that day was 916.
As of 25 July, there were 5,9745 confirmed cases in Israel, with 448 deaths.
Faced with the rapid rebound of the epidemic, the Israeli government has taken emergency measures to strengthen the epidemic prevention and control.

On July 6, after the number of confirmed cases exceeded 30,000, the Israeli government closed gyms, swimming pools, bars, nightclubs, and other public entertainment facilities, and introduced a restrictive public transport policy, requiring no more than 20 passengers per bus.
On 17 May, the government announced a series of new restrictions, including the introduction of a "season" on weekends, which would apply from 17:00 on Fridays to 5:00 on Sundays.

During this period, people will be able to go out, but shops, shopping centers, barbershops, beauty salons, libraries, zoos, museums, exhibition centers, swimming pools and tourist attractions will be closed, while basic services such as supermarkets and pharmacies will remain open.

At the same time, meetings of more than 10 people are prohibited on all dates and times, gyms, studios, etc. will be closed, restaurants and cafes are prohibited from eating together, and only out-of-the-box services are allowed.
At the same time, the Israeli people have not paid sufficient attention to the seriousness of the epidemic and have failed to join forces with the government in fighting the epidemic.
After repeated outbreaks of the disease in Israel, many people took to the streets to protest the government's control measures affecting their own economic interests.
On 11 July, tens of thousands of people demonstrated in Tel Aviv, claiming that the anti-epidemic policy was affecting the economy.

On the evening of 21 July, thousands of protesters gathered in front of Netanyahu's residence in Jerusalem, protesting against the measures, including a ban on restaurants and cafeterias, and the failure to compensate.

In addition, many people do not wear masks and keep two meters of safety distance from social gatherings while outdoors, and to avoid being fined by police for not wearing a mask, many people wear masks only on their chins or hanging on their wrists.

The school is a severely affected area for the spread of the new crown virus during the repeated outbreaks. According to a recent visit to the kindergarten, teachers and students in the kindergarten did not wear masks as required by the government, nor did they maintain a two-meter safe social distance between each other, so as to hide the danger of a large number of teachers and students infected with the virus.

Professor Eli Waxman, a member of the Advisory Group of Experts on the Israeli National Security Council's response to the epidemic, said that Israel was moving towards a "dangerous situation" and that the current epidemic prevention and control measures taken by Israel were not sufficient.

Mr. Waxman said Israel lacks a comprehensive plan to combat the disease, and that parliament and government departments should quickly abandon their interests and reach agreement on the issue of combating the disease, including clear steps to restrict the various sectors.

"4 students drowned in Arong flag incident in Inner Mongolia" - China News Agency
On the evening of July 25, a reporter from the government of Aryong Banner in the city of Hulunber, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, reported that four students had drowned.
At 15:50 on 24 July, 110 officers of the Aryongqi Public Security Bureau were told by the police that six junior high school students had drowned.
The police arrived at the scene and immediately rescued two students, and the local emergency department, water conservancy bureau and other units were on the scene, participating in the rescue.

The rescue team was composed of more than 80 people from the police, fire department, fire department, medical department, and other departments, and sent three rubber boats to the area to search for the missing persons.

The reporters learned that local rescuers found the first victim at 06:40 on July 25, the second victim at 11:30 on July 25, the third victim at 12:40 on July 25, and the last victim at 13:34 on July 25.
