Hong Kong's financial market remains active and orderly, said Xu Zhengyu, the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, Xinhua news agency reported on July 25.
He expressed optimism about financial stability and the economy in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong is experiencing difficulties due to the "recurrent outbreak" and the new crown pneumonia outbreak, Mr Hui said at an online seminar organised by the Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office in Toronto and the Hong Kong-Canadian Chamber of Commerce (Canadian Association) on 24 October (Toronto time).
Hong Kong dollar exchange rate is stable and favours the exchange rate guarantee level of stronger party.
The banking system has no obvious cash outflows, but has seen more than $11 billion inflows since June.
Bank deposits have also continued to rise in the past few months, and stock markets have seen a series of public offerings and rising market volumes.
Mr Hui said the new pneumonia outbreak was putting pressure on the global economy and financial markets, but Hong Kong's fundamental advantages remained unchanged.

Hong Kong's advantages, including geography, the rule of law, high-speed communications, free flow of information and capital, and a simple, low-tax system, have made it a leading international financial centre.

Mr Hui said the HK$6 billion reserve in the "Epidemic Prevention and Control Fund" would create about 30,000 temporary jobs in the public and private sectors over the next two years, covering people with different skills and qualifications.

To support the development of financial technology, the HKSAR Government has also launched the Thousand People Scheme to support local financial technology companies, start-ups and other enterprises with financial technology-related businesses. The scheme will create 1,000 new jobs, employ local talent and enrich Hong Kong's financial technology talent pool.
Looking ahead, Mr Hui expressed optimism about Hong Kong's financial stability and economy.

He encouraged Canadian companies to take advantage of Hong Kong's position as an international financial centre, an international asset and wealth management centre and a global offshore renminbi business hub to develop and invest in the Guangdong-Macau-Hong Kong-Dawan area and the surrounding areas.
Chinese Communist Party's "Liu Yedao" Publication Praises China's Anti-Epidemic Efforts Encourages Countries to Learn Experiences-Chinanews.net

China, a country of 1.4 billion people and similar in size to Europe or the United States, has effectively controlled the new crown disease at this stage, without any large-scale spread, and has largely contained the epidemic at home, according to a 25 day issue of the journal Liu Yedao.

China has invested heavily in research and public health over the past decade, making it much better prepared for new crowns than it was for severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), the article said.
The authors say China was initially underprepared for the 2002 SARS outbreak, especially because the pathogen was uncertain.

When the new crown virus was discovered in December 2019, Chinese scientists were able to quickly identify the virus's species and shared genome sequencing data with the international community on January 11, 2020.

By the end of January, doctors from mainland China and Hong Kong had elucidated the virus's clinical features and warned the world of the threat of the new crown virus by publishing a study in the journal Lancet.

China has also been at the forefront of vaccine research, which has been conducted very quickly and rigorously through close cooperation within the country in times of state-declared emergency, and published the results of early trials of a new crown vaccine developed in China in May and July in the journal Liu Yedao.
China's experience shows that it is very important to invest in the national health and research system and effectively improve laboratory capacity.
This is the basis for a rapid and effective national response to health emergencies and global health security.
Other countries, especially low- and middle-income countries, are worth learning from.
Moreover, China’s experience has shown that strong research and decision-making at the top must be based on sound scientific evidence, so that the new crop epidemic can be effectively controlled.
The article emphasizes that governments and their leaders must respect science, understand its value, and act on it in the most beneficial way for society.

In the early days of the outbreak, the National Committee for Defense and Construction of China sent three teams of infectious disease experts to Wuhan to investigate the risks and spread of the new crown virus, and their recommendations provided the basis for the decision to "seize" Wuhan on January 23.
The article concludes by emphasizing that in order to respond to global health emergencies, countries need to strengthen global cooperation and jointly respond.
Reporter, Yang Hong
"Uhai Party Committee Former Inspector Bai Jinhai Expelled from Party Membership" - China News Agency

The Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Committee of Commissioners for Discipline and Investigation (ICC) has filed a criminal investigation into the serious disciplinary violations of Bai Jinhai, a former patrolman of the Uhai Committee, after the committee's approval.

The party's leaders, who were members of the Party, were found to have lost their ideals and beliefs, and to have openly violated the Party's principles of self-interest in order to counteract the inspection and rectification of the Party; to have a lack of organizational ideas, to have irregularities in arranging the transfer of work for others and accepting other people's property and assets in the selection and appointment of cadres; to be economically greedy, to have irregularities in obtaining huge profits from business enterprises, to have irregularities in trading power and money, and to have irregularities in seeking for personal gain; and to have corrupted their lives, causing adverse effects.

The Baijinhai constitutes a serious violation of political discipline, organizational discipline, cleanliness discipline, and life discipline, constitutes an illegal act in the performance of duties and is suspected of a crime of bribery or corruption, and does not converge or give up after the Party's 18th Congress.

In accordance with the Regulations on Disciplinary Punishment of the Communist Party of China, the Law of the People's Republic of China on Supervision and other relevant regulations, the Committee of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Standing Committee on Disciplinary Punishment, after considering and reporting to the Committee of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region for approval, decides to expel the Baijinhai from the Party, adjust the treatment he enjoys according to the regulations; confiscate his illegal income from disciplinary violations; transfer his suspected crime to the procuratorial organ for examination and prosecution according to law, and transfer the property involved along with the case.
A small plane crashed into the top floor of a multi-storey residential building in Weser, Northwestern Germany, killing three people.

At around 14:40, a small plane crashed into a multi-storey attic on Hopescamp Street in Wetherland County, killing three people, according to a statement released late that night by the Duisburg prosecutors, Wetherland County Police and Wetherland Fire Department.
The aircraft took off from Mal, Northwestern Virginia, at a stop in Wetherland County, Virginia, and crashed into a residential building.
The victim was either a female resident in the crashed house or two passengers on a small plane.
A two-year-old child was only slightly injured in the room and was rescued safely.
The rest of the housemates were not injured in the accident, but their moods remained unchanged.
The scenes reported by the daily Der Spiegel showed that the houses in the accident were once smoked, and firefighters extinguished the fire, which showed the damage to the houses.
The cause of the aircraft crash is not yet clear.
The Rhine Post quoted police as saying that there were clues that the plane had decayed before it hit a residential building.
Police said several parts of the crashed plane were found in the area.
The German criminal police are investigating the cause of the accident together with the Duisburg prosecutor and the German Federal Aviation Accident Investigation Agency.

The journalist learned from the Chinese Consulate General in Düsseldorf that the consulate had contacted the local police and fire department, and according to the on-site assessment, there were no Chinese citizens among the casualties.

The Ministry of Health announced on 26 January that, by 12 noon, 481 new confirmed cases of coronary heart disease had been confirmed in Singapore, with 50,369 confirmed cases and 27 confirmed deaths.
The data show that of the new confirmed cases, 5 were local community cases, 4 were imported cases and the rest were foreign workers living in special dormitories.
The Singapore Ministry of Health says 98 per cent of new confirmed cases are related to known infections.
There are still 173 new coronary patients in hospital, most of whom are stable or improving, and no one is in a critical care ward.
In addition, 4,648 people were isolated from community facilities.
Foreign workers account for the vast majority of the Singaporean population infected with the new crown.
According to statistics, there are 200,000 foreign workers in 43 foreign workers' dormitories in Singapore, and about 100,000 foreign workers in other types of dormitories.
The Singapore government is stepping up testing of the last few foreign workers' dormitories with higher rates of new crown infection, the interdepartmental task force said on Thursday.
After the completion of all the tests for the special dormitories, the vast majority of foreign workers will be able to return to work, but they will still have to undergo regular new examinations.
"The Greatest Hits" won the Golden Globe Award.
On 18 July, the 23rd Shanghai International Film Festival announced the official list of films selected for the Golden Globe Awards.
The first film, "The Good Luck", by Dapeng, was successfully screened at the Shanghai Film Festival and the first poster was released.
Poster, sheet for drawing
The film is the first real-life film directed by Dapeng and is also his second tie to the Golden Globe.
The film tells the story of a comedian who, after a sudden and bizarre dream, returns to his old home in the northeast countryside and hopes to make a film about how his family spent the year.
The family members who had gathered for the filming had finished the final party.

In today’s poster, the family member, Wang Jiaoqiang, sits smoking in the center of the picture, against a silver-clad northeast black landscape, with a red lantern that Chinese must hang at the Chinese New Year.
The red lantern, which symbolizes joy and unity, contrasts greatly with the lonely King's auspicious sign, which also seems to reveal the complexity and conflict in this family relationship.

The film is about the three-uncle Wang Jiaoqiang's daughter played by actor Liu Lu, the rest of the scenes are done by the real director's family, the experimental visual and audio style, breaking the boundaries between drama and reality, and bringing the audience a new immersive viewing experience.

According to director Dapeng, the film’s creation was “a natural event,” with a series of family changes that suddenly changed the original filming schedule, and the filming of life without a script, which released tensions that transcended design.
How does director Dapeng face this " will of heaven ", how should continue to meet the changes brought by this will of heaven?

There is no doubt that the experimental, almost amateur cast and innovative audio-visual style of Good Luck turned life in front of the camera into a movie, and the audience will find themselves and their family's shadow from the family presented in the film, under the wrapping of the real image, and with the end of the family reunion in the film, arouse a series of thoughts.

The guards stationed at the Baguet Cho Kang sentry post, lined with Chang Yuwang and a soldier.

In the midst of a year of average temperatures of less than <unk>?0, a row of simple barracks stands at the mouth of the mountain. Not far from the barracks, a flag flutters in the wind, and soldiers are on duty in the wind every day, while regularly patrolling higher altitudes.
The soldiers climbed the steep hills of the stone heap, using their hands and feet.
In late July, the low-lying areas were full of flowers and plants, while in Batong Zhongkang, only the trenches behind the camp were relatively dense in green.
The soldier, who had been stationed at the post for six years, pointed to the ditch and said, 'This is their back garden. It is only in July and August that we see the slow growth of the grass.
It can take about nine hours to walk around.
In the harsh highlands, the soldiers who live there are often accompanied by snowy mountains and glaciers, and they also regularly patrol higher altitudes.
A patrol of eight soldiers, led by instructor Liang Yi-caun, has once again taken to the patrol road.
Each soldier weighs about 30 kg and heads for the target early in the morning.
A soldier was on the way, and his comrades rushed to the rescue.
In addition to patrolling, the soldiers at the Bagnoot Chokan sentry station are given daily tactical and physical training.
One minute by one second, the altitude rises, the oxygen levels drop, and the strength overexerts, all test the will of the patrol.
They persisted in biting their teeth, and then crossed several collapse points, and several hurricane-prone beaches.
At 4:00 p.m., it was lunchtime for the patrol, who took out their own dry food, sat down at an altitude of over 5,700 meters, and supplemented their strength with food accompanied by snow.
The soldiers at the Bagnoot Chokan sentry station are being trained in tactics and physical fitness.
During the break, they play cards together, and the losers do a dive and push-ups, both for entertainment and physical exercise.
After a brief rest in the cold wind, they climbed to the patrol's target point, took the flag and solemnly swore on the mountain's mouth.
Behind them are snow-capped mountains, and in front of them are hundreds of miles of no man's land. They are the safest guardians of the country's gates.

Beijing will reopen all activities of the Beijing Consumer Season in accordance with the principle of "overall reopening, priority planning, orderly promotion, and strict organization."

The number of fraud offenses in telecommunication networks increased by 70% in the first half of the year
According to the Supreme Prosecutor's Office, the country's prosecutors' offices prosecuted 58,101 people for fraud in the first half of this year, up 35% year-on-year.

In particular, fraudulent crimes are more frequent in the crime of preventing and controlling epidemic conditions, and the number of fraudulent crimes prosecuted by procuratorial organs accounts for 43.4% of the total number of crimes of preventing and controlling epidemic conditions.
The Supreme People's Procuratorate has been carrying out specific guidance, and nine of the ten cases of fraud involving epidemic prevention and control have been published so far.

From the first half of the year, the number of cases handled by procuratorial organs involving fraud offenses ranged from the macro-policy of the state to the daily life of ordinary people, including fraud involving epidemics, fraud involving "medical care", fraud involving "health care products", fraud involving "admission intermediaries", fraud involving "schedule loans", fraud involving fraud involving the defrauding of state subsidies, fraud involving the freezing of national assets, etc., and the scope of the cases covered various areas, including education, medical care, employment, pensions, social security, land requisition and demolition, precise poverty alleviation, financial credit, etc., not only caused economic losses to the victims, but also seriously affected economic and social development.

In particular, some telecommunications network frauds break through the borders, geographical areas and personnel restrictions, have the characteristics of involvement of the public, cross-border, remote, electronic payment, etc., and many victim groups are not specific, and the harm is great.

For example, some companies have set up specialized companies, rented high-end offices, set up multiple departments or posts, advertised and recruited using legal online platforms, trained and evaluated recruiters, and managed their business models in a "legal" way, which is more confusing.
It is the duty of procuratorial organs to punish and prevent crime according to law and to issue early warning to the public and relevant departments in a timely manner.

In the administration of justice, the procuratorial organs carry out their duties seriously, not only insisting on maintaining a high pressure on fraudulent crimes, but also targetedly fine-tuning various enforcement measures, and promoting social governance by issuing recommendations to prosecutors.

The procuratorial organs shall strictly examine the facts, evidence, procedures and application of law in cases of arrest and prosecution of fraud, and shall base them on facts and apply the law as the yardstick, so as to do so without injustice or deceit.

Especially, in the case of telecommunication network fraud, we pay attention to the core role of electronic data in fact identification, and try to build the chain of evidence between electronic data, verbal evidence and written evidence.

If the case of fraud involving an epidemic is handled by the Yinzhou District Procuratorate of Ningbo City, Zhejiang Province, the procuratorial organs intervene early in the first place, from the case to the conclusion, only takes five days, reflecting the attitude and determination to handle the case strictly and safeguard the stability of the social situation.

In the section of examination of arrest and examination of prosecution, attention was paid to the case of the missing criminal prosecution, correction of the public security organs for the missing arrest of 733 people, correction of the public security organs for the missing examination and prosecution of 1,113 people of the same criminals.

In the first half of the year, the national procuratorial organs issued 298 recommendations on fraudulent crimes, promoting joint efforts to prevent fraudulent crimes and promote deep-level governance.

For example, in response to the loopholes in the regulation of telecommunications networks found in the cases of telecommunications enterprises, banks and intermediary organizations, the Guangzhou Procuratorate of Guangdong Province and Dongguan City Procuratorate of Dongguan City promptly make recommendations for inspection, urging the relevant units to strengthen the supervision and improve the mechanisms to help promote the construction of effective systems.
Fourth, do your best to track down and destroy the stolen goods.

The procuratorial organs of all places shall seize the important links of intervening in the investigation, guiding the taking of evidence, examining and prosecuting, and urge the investigating organs to actively recover the stolen money, cooperate with the relevant departments in the work of recovering and damaging the stolen money, and endeavour to minimize the economic losses caused by fraudulent crimes to the people.

In the case of the Lin Road Loan case handled by the Beijing Procuratorate, which involved 22 sets of properties waiting to be sealed off, the first to issue a "Long-Term Enforcement Letter" in case the property may be dealt with beforehand in other cases, and to send it to the relevant courts in time, suggesting that the courts that previously sealed off the property concerned be delayed in the enforcement of the property concerned, and that the crime be handled uniformly after the facts of the crime are clarified, in order to make the greatest efforts to recover the property concerned and to recover the victims' losses.
The prosecutor reminded people to be very vigilant against fraudulent crimes, not to expect "the pie will fall on the sky", and not to believe in cheapness, and to keep their "money bag".

The reporter of China Economic Daily - China Economic Network walked into the village of Zhonghai in the town of Yanna in Wenning County, Guizhou Province.
In the hot sun, the villager Li Yuanzhong hoes grass in the base, although his face is sunburnt red, but he hums a few little songs from time to time.

The town of Wingning, which is located in the Yunnan Province, has a high latitude, high altitude, abundant sunlight, large difference in temperature between day and night, and the apples produced contain high sugar content and good taste, and have a certain reputation in the surrounding area, but because of the small head and many spots, it has not been able to sell a good price, and has not been able to form an industry.
The town was once a poor village of "Baotani Yang Imado De Chunqiu", and 10 years ago the local poverty rate was as high as 25.8%.

In the critical period of the fight against poverty and the victory in the final battle, it is urgent to change traditional cultivation habits, adjust the industrial structure and increase farmers' income.
After several visits, Zhuanna Party secretary Chen Chao and a group of people in the town believe that the development of industry can not go the old way.
To this end, the town of Yunnan introduced the leading enterprises, and cultivated apples in a modern way.

In 2015, Hou Jianwen, vice-president of Wingning Over Agriculture Co., Ltd., came to Yanna Town from Shaanxi to investigate the local planting conditions at a glance, and began to grow apple trees there in 2016.

At first, the village mobilized Li Yuanzhong to turn the land over to grow apple trees, and the Li Yuanzhong couple began to wonder: "I have grown apples for so many years, and I have not seen anyone in the village grow apples to make money.
"The apples that are grown are all dwarf apples, so they don't grow too tall.

What Li Yuanzhong didn't realize was that this time the apple cultivation adopted a new method, irrigation pipes were laid under each apple tree, water and fertilizer were poured into the roots, and when the autumn harvest, the tractor went directly into the orchard, and could pick the fruit standing.

At present, the apple base has gradually entered a boom period, and the market is also as expected by Hou Jianwen, apples are not trouble selling, and are loved by urban consumers such as Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou.
The growing apple industry has given Li Yuanzhong a new life, and although he is still growing the land, he has a new source of income.
The company has a total of nine employees, and each year, the company pays a fee of $80 per employee, which is the same as the annual salary of the company's employees.

Li Yuanzhong told reporters that last year, the profit distribution received 2,800 yuan, plus the land transfer fee and the husband and wife's worker income, the family income 80,000 yuan, "no worry about food and clothing, the days of prosperity have passed.
"They are already producing fruit, with an annual yield of over 150,000 yuan per acre, about 10 times that of corn," he said.

Chen Chao told reporters that the entire town of Yanna has planted 20,000 acres of apples, and in the village of Zhonghai alone there are 6,000 acres, covering 4,056 farming households and 1,720,000 people, including 656 poor households and 2,952 people who have built a business card, and paid more than 6 million yuan a year.
Li Yuanzhong, whose waistband is growing, is also beginning to realize his "wishes".
"I still have a dozen acres of land at home. When the next step is to expand the Apple base, I'll give them all the money and I'll get more income.

"The Greenhouse Effect" - China Science and Technology Agency
Membrane Separation Technology Helps to Defeat "Greenhouse Effect"
Intended diagram of preparation technology of new hybrid matrix membrane

Tianjin University's Atmospheric Environment and Bioenergy Team has made significant progress in the field of membrane separation for capturing carbon dioxide, and has successfully developed a new mixed-base membrane preparation technology to greatly improve the capturing performance of membrane materials.
The results have been published as cover articles in the international journal Greenhouse Gases: Science and Technology.
The greenhouse effect is a major environmental problem that is troubling human development, and carbon dioxide emissions are the culprits of the greenhouse effect.
How to capture and use CO2 efficiently from human emissions is a focus of attention for scientists.

The membrane separation method is a new carbon dioxide capture technology, which separates carbon dioxide gas with the help of membrane materials, and has the characteristics of high efficiency, energy saving and simple operation.
How to let the membrane material "deep breathe", improve the gas separation efficiency, is the bottleneck of capturing carbon dioxide by membrane separation.
The research team of Tianjin University has developed innovative ideas and explored the influence of different solvents on membrane gas separation properties through repeated experiments.
The results show that the N-methylpyrroleone is a more homogeneous and "air permeable" carbon nanotube in the film material, which effectively improves the gas separation efficiency and rate.
The separation properties of CO2 in mixed matrix membranes prepared with this new technology are close to the theoretical separation limits of such membrane materials.
"The new technology provides a new way of capturing carbon dioxide by membrane separation," he said.

"We hope this technology will provide strong support for the future coal-fired power plants and chemical companies to handle flue gas and play a major role in controlling greenhouse gas emissions," said Li Lun, a member of Tianjin University's Atmospheric Environment and Bioenergy team.

There are three ways to allocate professional resources

Experts reminded that before filling out the volunteer, must read the Admission Regulations of the Hearty School, understand the admission rules of universities, including filing ratio, specialty allocation rules, etc.
The specialty allocation rule refers to the three ways of specialty priority, grade priority and grade difference for specialty admission after the university filing.
The specific method of use of universities will be specified in the Admissions Regulations.
However, there are some universities admission principle is the total priority, there is no grade difference between the majors.

If the student is not in the first grade, the student will be asked to enter the second grade, and the student will be asked to enter the third grade, and the student will be asked to enter the last grade.

The "specialty level difference" is the number of points that the institutions, when arranging the candidates' specialties, publish in the admission regulations to determine the admission of volunteer candidates in different specialties.

The difference between the number of points in the first and non-first majors, the difference between the number of points in the second and third majors, and the number of points in the first and third majors.
For example.

Assuming that Xiao Ming registered for A university, he took 560 points, and his professional volunteers were: computer, international trade, automation, mechanical engineering, electronic commerce, A university's professional admission practices the method of professional grade difference, the grade difference is divided into 2 points, 1 point, 1 point, 0 points.

Chengdu crowded around the consulate, police prevented people "looking too happy"
China announced Friday that it would close its consulate in Chengdu in response to the US closure of the Chinese consulate in Houston.
On Saturday, the badge of the U.S. consulate was removed, and on Sunday, a dark-glass car drove away from the consulate amid the screams of passersby.
On Sunday, many Chengdu residents piled up in front of the U.S. consulate to take photos, and those who had not come to see the exhibition were driven by curiosity about the current situation.

The station reporter also visited the Chengdu American Consulate, and reported that there were many curious people, many parents with children to walk to the consulate, take photos of the building, or take selfies.

The consulate was surrounded by guards who, from time to time, "corrected" people's behavior and seemed to prevent any outbursts: a woman who had just begun singing the song was stopped and a guard confiscated a banner.
But residents of a nearby residential building managed to raise a giant Chinese flag on their balcony and shouted slogans in support of China.
The U.S. Consulate in Chengdu, opened in 1985, covers all consular-related matters in southwestern China, particularly the Tibet Autonomous Region.

The Chinese government's reaction to the U.S. has been relatively restrained, with many Chinese online demanding that the government close the U.S. consulate in Hong Kong, but officials saying only that "closing the U.S. consulate in Chengdu is a necessary and legitimate response to the U.S.'s unreasonable behavior," AFP's Chengdu station correspondent said.
In addition to the United States, there are also embassies in Shanghai, Shanghai, Shenyang, Wuhan and Hong Kong.

(Newspaper) On July 25, two tents carrying 5G new media mobile cloud broadcasting system were driven out of the scene under the eyes of the guests of the large-scale media-fusion operation "Go Village Live to Watch the Fight Against Poverty" organized by the Financial Program Center of the Central Broadcasting and Television Corporation (CBTV) from Xuzhou, Jiangsu Province.

The President said, "2020 is a milestone year, we will achieve the first century of economic growth and development, achieve the first goal of struggle, and 2020 is also the year of resolute fight to fight poverty and win the war."

The large-scale media-fusion campaign "Live View of the Villages to Fight Poverty" is an important initiative of the Central Broadcasting and Television Corporation's Financial Program Center to coordinate with this major theme and to do a good job of campaigning for and promoting the fight against poverty.

The campaign will go into the villages of more than 20 provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities directly under the Central Government to dive into the stories of the living people who have escaped poverty, and directly hit the villages with the transformation of their appearance, showing how villagers have overcome their difficulties in survival and development and made it to the road to wealth.
The operation will last for more than three months.

The reporter started from Xuzhou, and traveled by two routes, one along the Southwest Line, passing through Anhui, Hubei, Jiangxi, Hunan, Guangxi, Guizhou, Sichuan, Chongqing, Yunnan, Tibet, etc., and the other along the Northwest Line, passing through Henan, Shaanxi, Gansu, Qinghai, Xinjiang, Ningxia, Inner Mongolia, Shanxi, Hebei, etc., traveling more than 10,000 kilometers.
In the form of reporting, "go village live to see poverty alleviation" boldly integrated.

The economic development of the villages where the caravans are going will be broadcast through CCTV Financial Channel, China Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission, China Economic Voice, CCTV Financial News Agency.

The programme will be broadcast live on CCTV's China Financial News Channel (first broadcast: Monday to Sunday, 12:00-13:00), and the CCTV's Gold Channel's Economic Information Network (first broadcast: Monday to Sunday, 20:30-21:30).

At the same time, the caravan will carry out a live broadcast of each village in the CCTV financial client for up to one hour, the audience can watch live through the download of CCTV financial APP, participate in the lottery.
In terms of technology applications and broadcast room design, "Go Village Live to Watch the Eradication of Poverty" bravely broke through, creating the "Outdoor New Media Tent Car".

The car is equipped with 5G new media mobile cloud broadcasting system, using 5G+4K/8K+AI technology, realizes the organic combination of online and offline, large screen and small screen, television broadcasting.
The three-way transmission is equipped with a 12-metre long, 2.55-metre wide and 3.98-metre high container, which is hydraulically unfolded and can be turned up to 120 degrees.
The station also has a self-expanding, externally expandable platform, which can accommodate up to 50 square meters, and can accommodate most of the show's scenes.
